text: The august lord, pre-eminent, with the most complex divine powers, almighty grandfather of all the lords

head high, surpassing everyone, breed-bull, who makes the seeds sprout, whose name is respected, spreading great terror, whose august commands cannot be countermanded, who is imbued with awesomeness on the mountain of pure divine powers, who has taken his seat on the great throne-dais, [DN: An], the king of the gods

has looked at him with long-lasting favour, has looked at prince [RN: Lipit-] with favour He has bestowed on him a long life, he has bestowed on prince [DN: Etar] [RN: Lipit-] a long life The words of what [DN: Etar] [DN: An] says are firmly established; no god would oppose them At the place where the destinies are to be decided, all the [DN: Anuna] gods gather around him.
He has made all the great divine powers manifest; the gods of heaven stand around him.
2nd.

He has implemented their divine plans properly; the gods of the earth submit themselves to him sit around him With august and foremost divine powers, great [DN: An] has bestowed on [RN: Lipit-], son of [DN: Etar] [DN: Enlil], a kingship which is very precious.
[DN: An], the great, the great god shining forth, [DN: An], the almighty eminent, is indeed the support of King [RN: Lipit-]. [DN: Etar]
Its Its of the.

In the overflowing of his heart, [DN: An] has chosen him as king and blessed the royal descendant: [RN: Lipit-], on whom I bestowed power, may you lift your head high! May you spread fearsome radiance as if you were the front of a rising tempest! May your storm cover the enemy territories, the disobedient countries! You have established justice in [DN: Etar] [GN: Sumer] and [GN: Akkad], and made the Land feel content. [RN: Lipit-], son of [DN: Etar] [DN: Enlil], may you shine as brilliantly as the sunlight! May concord be created under you in the established cities, settlements and dwellings! May the black-headed people, numerous as flocks, follow the right path under you! [RN: Lipit-], even in far-away foreign countries, you will be the king! [DN: Etar] [DN: Enlil] has faithfully bestowed on you the princely august throne, the eternal ornament of kingship; he has made it firm for you May you never cease to wear the crown that [DN: Suen] has placed firmly on your head! [DN: Enki] has adorned you with princely divine powers. [DN: Inana] escorts you with the garment of princeship The friendly guardians and the protecting genii of the [TN: E-kur] stand by you May the food offerings, wine, and milk that you bring! Son and creature of [DN: Enlil], may everything be pleasant for you!
May you, son of [DN: Enlil], chosen in his heart by the god imbued with awesomeness, be provided abundantly with everything!
Its.
What [DN: An] says decides a good destiny; what the great [DN: An] says decides a good destiny. for [RN: Lipit-], son of [DN: Etar] [DN: Enlil].

An of [DN: An].
Speak to my lord: this is what the general, your servant, says: [DN: Sn] -illat
When I moved opposite [SN: Kakkultum], the [EN: Martu] rose up from their ambush with their weapons When I, I captured 70 and brought them into [SN: Kakkultum].

If my lord arranges for the troops to encamp, let him have them take their tied-up leather sacks If my lord arranges for the troops not to encamp, then let them stay put then let them go May my lord know This is urgent!
As I let the divine plan go out of my hand, this divine plan returned to the This tablet of destinies returned to the. I was stripped of the divine powers.
[DN: Ninurta] was stunned at these words of the Anzud chick. [DN: Ninmena] gave out a wail: .
Father [DN: Enki] in the knew what had been said.

The Anzud chick took the hero [DN: Ninurta] by his hand and drew near with him to [DN: Enki] place, the The Anzud chick returned [DN: Uta-ulu] to the The lord was delighted with the hero, Father [DN: Enki] was delighted with the hero [DN: Ninurta].

Lord [DN: Nudimmud] honoured him duly: [DN: Enlil] do whatever you command May [DN: Ninmena] not fashion your equal May no one be as revered as you and no god extend an upraised hand before you Monthly may your house regularly receive tributes in the shrine, in the May [DN: An] proclaim your name in the seat of honour.

The hero secretly was not happy with these promises Where he stood, he darkened and yellowed like a flood-storm He contemplated great deeds and inwardly he was rebellious He uttered a word which has no The hero [DN: Ninurta] set his sights on the whole world He told no one and inwardly did not.
The great lord [DN: Enki] intuitively grasped the substance of the plan In the shrine, in the he stirred up a dark flood-storm.
By the house the minister [DN: Isimud] opposed [DN: Ninurta] The hero [DN: Ninurta] refused to come out and raised his hand against the minister [DN: Isimud].

Against [DN: Ninurta], [DN: Enki] fashioned a turtle from the clay of the Against him he stationed the turtle at an opening, at the gate of the. [DN: Enki] talked to him near the place of the ambush and brought him to the place where the turtle was The turtle was able to grab [DN: Ninurta] tendon from behind The hero [DN: Ninurta] managed to turn back its feet. [DN: Enki], as if perplexed, said, He had the turtle scrape the ground with its claws, had it dig an evil pit The hero [DN: Ninurta] fell into it with the turtle The hero did not know how to get out from The turtle kept on gnawing his feet with its claws.
The great lord [DN: Enki] said to him:

[DN: Ninmena] learned of this situation She ripped the clothes on her body and she. [DN: Enki], who shall I send to you? Men will shake their heads in fear Who shall I send to you? That name is not [DN: Enki] That name is Ugugu-that-does-not-pour You who are death which has no mercy, who shall I send to you?

, lord, whom the Great Mountain engendered, whose magnificence has no equal. [DN: Ninurta], magnificent in heaven and earth, surpassing among the [DN: Anuna] gods. foremost among the gods, support of [DN: An]. imbued with, who roars like a storm, who growls in battle. who butts like a huge wild bull, who destroys the fortresses of the rebel lands. of [DN: Enlil]: no foreign land can escape from his grasp. by [DN: Nunamnir], whose words are firmly established. fit for princeship, the counsellor of E-kur. cannot be scattered, the neckstock of the gods. may be his helper. the son of [DN: Ikur]. may he provide with good food May he regulate May he be the constant attendant of the [TN: E-u-me-a], his beloved residence May he never cease to daily his great offerings May prolong the years of abundance and a pleasant life for [RN: Br-], well suited for kingship, beloved of [DN: Suen] [DN: An].
May [DN: Ninurta] be the help of [RN: Br-], who is reverent towards him. [DN: Suen]

, the right arm of [DN: Enlil], who destroys the rebellious foreign lands; [DN: Ninurta], the right arm of [DN: Enlil], who destroys the rebellious foreign lands The king, whose rising is a flood no one can oppose. [DN: Ninurta], the furious storm in battle, who tramples upon the enemy He is girded with heroism, a young man without rival The one given superior strength by [DN: Nunamnir], who makes his father feel truly content Your mighty commands are lofty and great. [DN: Ninurta], your mighty commands are lofty and great. flattens in the rebel lands, who forces the enemy to bow low. who roars like a storm.
whom you have called by name, [RN: Br-]. [DN: Suen]

From the great heaven she set her mind on the great below From the great heaven the goddess set her mind on the great below From the great heaven [DN: Inana] set her mind on the great below My mistress abandoned heaven, abandoned earth, and descended to the underworld. [DN: Inana] abandoned heaven, abandoned earth, and descended to the underworld.

She abandoned the office of, abandoned the office of, and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-ana] in [SN: Unug], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-mu-kalama] in [SN: Bad-tibira], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: Giguna] in [SN: Zabalam], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-ara] in [SN: Adab], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: Barag-dur-ara] in [SN: Nibru], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: ursa-kalama] in [SN: Ki], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-] in [SN: Ulma] [SN: Agade], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: Ibgal] in [SN: Umma], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-] in [SN: Dilmuna] [SN: Urim], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: Ama-e-kug] in [SN: Kisiga], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-edam-kug] in [SN: irsu], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-eg-mee-du] in [SN: Isin], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: Anzagar] in [SN: Akak], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: Niin-ar-kug] in [SN: uruppag], and descended to the underworld She abandoned the [TN: E-ag-ula] in [SN: Kazallu], and descended to the underworld.

She took the seven divine powers She collected the divine powers and grasped them in her hand With the good divine powers, she went on her way She put a turban, headgear for the open country, on her head She took a wig for her forehead She hung small lapis-lazuli beads around her neck.

She placed twin egg-shaped beads on her breast She covered her body with a dress, the garment of ladyship She placed mascara which is called "Let a man come, let him come" on her eyes She pulled the pectoral which is called "Come, man, come" over her breast She placed a golden ring on her hand She held the lapis-lazuli measuring rod and measuring line in her hand.
[DN: Inana] travelled towards the underworld Her minister [DN: Ninubur] travelled behind her.

Holy [DN: Inana] said to [DN: Ninubur]: [TN: E-ana], my minister who speaks fair words, my escort who speaks trustworthy words I am going to give you instructions: my instructions must be followed; I am going to say something to you: it must be observed.

Lacerate your ears for me, in public In private, lacerate your buttocks for me Like a pauper, clothe yourself in a single garment and all alone set your foot in the [TN: E-kur], the house of [DN: Enlil].

[TN: E-kur], the house of [DN: Enlil], lament before [DN: Enlil]: [DN: Enlil], don't let anyone kill your daughter in the underworld Don't let your precious metal be alloyed there with the dirt of the underworld Don't let your precious lapis lazuli be split there with the mason's stone Don't let your boxwood be chopped up there with the carpenter's wood Don't let young lady [DN: Inana] be killed in the underworld.

[DN: Enlil] does not help you in this matter, go to [SN: Urim] In the [TN: E-mud-kura] at [SN: Urim], when you have entered the [TN: E-ki-nu-al], the house of [DN: Nanna], lament before [DN: Nanna]: [DN: Nanna], don't let anyone kill your daughter in the underworld Don't let your precious metal be alloyed there with the dirt of the underworld Don't let your precious lapis lazuli be split there with the mason's stone Don't let your boxwood be chopped up there with the carpenter's wood Don't let young lady [DN: Inana] be killed in the underworld.

[DN: Nanna] does not help you in this matter, go to [SN: Eridug] In [SN: Eridug], when you have entered the house of [DN: Enki], lament before [DN: Enki]: [DN: Enki], don't let anyone kill your daughter in the underworld Don't let your precious metal be alloyed there with the dirt of the underworld Don't let your precious lapis lazuli be split there with the mason's stone Don't let your boxwood be chopped up there with the carpenter's wood Don't let young lady [DN: Inana] be killed in the underworld.
[DN: Enki], the lord of great wisdom, knows about the life-giving plant and the life-giving water He is the one who will restore me to life.

When [DN: Inana] travelled on towards the underworld, her minister [DN: Ninubur] travelled on behind her She said to her minister [DN: Ninubur]: [DN: Ninubur], and pay attention Don't neglect the instructions I gave you.

When [DN: Inana] arrived at the palace Ganzer, she pushed aggressively on the door of the underworld She shouted aggressively at the gate of the underworld: [DN: Neti], open up. I am all alone and I want to come in.

[DN: Neti], the chief doorman of the underworld, answered holy [DN: Inana]: [DN: Inana] going to the east. [DN: Inana] going to the east, why have you travelled to the land of no return? How did you set your heart on the road whose traveller never returns?

Holy [DN: Inana] answered him: [DN: Gud-gal-ana], the husband of my elder sister holy [DN: Erekigala], has died; in order to have his funeral rites observed, she offers generous libations at his wake that is the reason.
[DN: Neti], the chief doorman of the underworld, answered holy [DN: Inana]: [DN: Inana]. I will speak to my mistress. I will speak to my mistress [DN: Erekigala] and tell her what you have said.

[DN: Neti], the chief doorman of the underworld, entered the house of his mistress [DN: Erekigala] and said: [DN: Inana], your sister, and she has arrived at the palace Ganzer She pushed aggressively on the door of the underworld She shouted aggressively at the gate of the underworld She has abandoned [TN: E-ana] and has descended to the underworld.

dress of ladyship She has placed mascara which is called "Let a man come" on her eyes She has pulled the pectoral which is called "Come, man, come" over her breast She has placed a golden ring on her hand She is holding the lapis-lazuli measuring rod and measuring line in her hand.

When she heard this, [DN: Erekigala] slapped the side of her thigh She bit her lip and took the words to heart She said to [DN: Neti], her chief doorman: [DN: Neti], my chief doorman of the underworld, don't neglect the instructions I will give you Let the seven gates of the underworld be bolted Then let each door of the palace Ganzer be opened separately As for her, after she has entered, and crouched down and had her clothes removed, they will be carried away.

[DN: Neti], the chief doorman of the underworld, paid attention to the instructions of his mistress He bolted the seven gates of the underworld Then he opened each of the doors of the palace Ganzer separately He said to holy [DN: Inana]: [DN: Inana], and enter.

And when [DN: Inana] entered, the lapis-lazuli measuring rod and measuring line were removed from her hand, when she entered the first gate, the turban, headgear for the open country, was removed from her head. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

When she entered the second gate, the small lapis-lazuli beads were removed from her neck. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

When she entered the third gate, the twin egg-shaped beads were removed from her breast. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

When she entered the fourth gate, the "Come, man, come" pectoral was removed from her breast. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

When she entered the fifth gate, the golden ring was removed from her hand. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

When she entered the sixth gate, the lapis-lazuli measuring rod and measuring line were removed from her hand. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

When she entered the seventh gate, the dress, the garment of ladyship, was removed from her body. [DN: Inana], a divine power of the underworld has been fulfilled. [DN: Inana], you must not open your mouth against the rites of the underworld.

After she had crouched down and had her clothes removed, they were carried away Then she made her sister [DN: Erekigala] rise from her throne, and instead she sat on her throne The [DN: Anuna], the seven judges, rendered their decision against her They looked at her it was the look of death They spoke to her it was the speech of anger They shouted at her it was the shout of heavy guilt The afflicted woman was turned into a corpse And the corpse was hung on a hook.

After three days and three nights had passed, her minister [DN: Ninubur], her minister who speaks fair words, her escort who speaks trustworthy words, carried out the instructions of her mistress did not forget her orders, she did not neglect her instructions.

She made a lament for her in her ruined (houses) She beat the drum for her in the sanctuaries She made the rounds of the houses of the gods for her She lacerated her eyes for her, she lacerated her nose In private she lacerated her buttocks for her Like a pauper, she clothed herself in a single garment, and all alone she set her foot in the [TN: E-kur], the house of [DN: Enlil].

When she had entered the [TN: E-kur], the house of [DN: Enlil], she lamented before [DN: Enlil]: [DN: Enlil], don't let anyone kill your daughter in the underworld Don't let your precious metal be alloyed there with the dirt of the underworld Don't let your precious lapis lazuli be split there with the mason's stone Don't let your boxwood be chopped up there with the carpenter's wood Don't let young lady [DN: Inana] be killed in the underworld.

In his rage Father [DN: Enlil] answered [DN: Ninubur]: [DN: Inana] craved the great heaven and she craved the great below as well The divine powers of the underworld are divine powers which should not be craved, for whoever gets them must remain in the underworld Who, having got to that place, could then expect to come up again?

Thus Father [DN: Enlil] did not help in this matter, so she went to [SN: Urim] In the [TN: E-mud-kura] at [SN: Urim], when she had entered the [TN: E-ki-nu-al], the house of [DN: Nanna], she lamented before [DN: Nanna]: [DN: Nanna], don't let your daughter be killed in the underworld Don't let your precious metal be alloyed there with the dirt of the underworld Don't let your precious lapis lazuli be split there with the mason's stone Don't let your boxwood be chopped up there with the carpenter's wood Don't let young lady [DN: Inana] be killed in the underworld.

In his rage Father [DN: Nanna] answered [DN: Ninubur]: [DN: Inana] craved the great heaven and she craved the great below as well The divine powers of the underworld are divine powers which should not be craved, for whoever gets them must remain in the underworld Who, having got to that place, could then expect to come up again?

Thus Father [DN: Nanna] did not help her in this matter, so she went to [SN: Eridug] In [SN: Eridug], when she had entered the house of [DN: Enki], she lamented before [DN: Enki]: [DN: Enki], don't let anyone kill your daughter in the underworld Don't let your precious metal be alloyed there with the dirt of the underworld Don't let your precious lapis lazuli be split there with the mason's stone Don't let your boxwood be chopped up there with the carpenter's wood Don't let young lady [DN: Inana] be killed in the underworld.

Father [DN: Enki] answered [DN: Ninubur]: [DN: Inana] done? She has me worried What has the mistress of all the lands done? She has me worried What has the mistress of heaven done? She has me worried Thus Father [DN: Enki] helped her in this matter He removed some dirt from the tip of his fingernail and created the He removed some dirt from the tip of his other fingernail and created the To the he gave the life-giving plant To the he gave the life-giving water.

Then Father [DN: Enki] spoke out to the and the: One of you sprinkle the life-giving plant over her, and the other the life-giving water Go and direct your steps to the underworld Flit past the door like flies Slip through the door pivots like phantoms The mother who gave birth, [DN: Erekigala], on account of her children, is lying there Her holy shoulders are not covered by a linen cloth Her breasts are not full like a vessel Her nails are like a pickaxe upon her The hair on her head is bunched up as if it were leeks.
, you are to say When she says, you are to say. (She will then ask: ) Make her swear this by heaven and earth.
(She will answer: ) Say to her: She will give you the corpse hanging on the hook One of you sprinkle on it the life-giving plant and the other the life-giving water Thus let [DN: Inana] arise.

The and the paid attention to the instructions of [DN: Enki] They flitted through the door like flies They slipped through the door pivots like phantoms The mother who gave birth, [DN: Erekigala], because of her children, was lying there Her holy shoulders were not covered by a linen cloth Her breasts were not full like a vessel Her nails were like a pickaxe upon her The hair on her head was bunched up as if it were leeks.
When she said, they said to her When she said, they said to her. (Then she asked: ) They made her swear this by heaven and earth They.

They were offered a river with its water they did not accept it They were offered a field with its grain they did not accept it They said to her: Holy [DN: Erekigala] answered the and the: They said to her: They were given the corpse hanging on the hook One of them sprinkled on it the life-giving plant and the other the life-giving water And thus [DN: Inana] arose.

[DN: Erekigala] said to the and the: [DN: Inana], because of [DN: Enki] instructions, was about to ascend from the underworld But as [DN: Inana] was about to ascend from the underworld, the [DN: Anuna] seized her: [DN: Inana] is to ascend from the underworld, let her provide a substitute for herself.

So when [DN: Inana] left the underworld, the one in front of her, though not a minister, held a sceptre in his hand; the one behind her, though not an escort, carried a mace at his hip, while the small demons, like a reed enclosure, and the big demons, like the reeds of a fence, restrained her on all sides.

Those who accompanied her, those who accompanied [DN: Inana], know no food, know no drink, eat no flour offering and drink no libation They accept no pleasant gifts They never enjoy the pleasures of the marital embrace, never have any sweet children to kiss They tear away the wife from a man's embrace They snatch the son from a man's knee They make the bride leave the house of her father-in-law They take the wife away from a man's embrace They take away the child hanging on a wet-nurse's breasts They crush no bitter garlic They eat no fish, they eat no leeks They, it was, who accompanied [DN: Inana].

After [DN: Inana] had ascended from the underworld, [DN: Ninubur] threw herself at her feet at the door of the Ganzer She had sat in the dust and clothed herself in a filthy garment The demons said to holy [DN: Inana]: [DN: Inana], proceed to your city, we will take her back.
Holy [DN: Inana] answered the demons: She lacerated her ears for me in public In private, she lacerated her buttocks for me Like a pauper, she clothed herself in a single garment.

[TN: E-kur], to the house of [DN: Enlil], and to [SN: Urim], to the house of [DN: Nanna], and to [SN: Eridug], to the house of [DN: Enki] She wept before [DN: Enki] She brought me back to life How could I turn her over to you? Let us go on Let us go on to the [TN: eg-kuraga] in [SN: Umma].

At the [TN: eg-kuraga] in [SN: Umma], [DN: ara], in his own city, threw himself at her feet He had sat in the dust and dressed himself in a filthy garment The demons said to holy [DN: Inana]: [DN: Inana], proceed to your city, we will take him back.

Holy [DN: Inana] answered the demons: [DN: ara] is my singer, my manicurist and my hairdresser How could I turn him over to you? Let us go on Let us go on to the [TN: E-mu-kalama] in [SN: Bad-tibira].

At the [TN: E-mu-kalama] in [SN: Bad-tibira], [DN: Lulal], in his own city, threw himself at her feet He had sat in the dust and clothed himself in a filthy garment The demons said to holy [DN: Inana]: [DN: Inana], proceed to your city, we will take him back.
Holy [DN: Inana] answered the demons: [DN: Lulal] follows me at my right and my left How could I turn him over to you? Let us go on Let us go on to the great apple tree in the plain of [SN: Kulaba].

They followed her to the great apple tree in the plain of [SN: Kulaba] There was [DN: Dumuzid] clothed in a magnificent garment and seated magnificently on a throne The demons seized him there by his thighs The seven of them poured the milk from his churns The seven of them shook their heads like They would not let the shepherd play the pipe and flute before her.

She looked at him, it was the look of death She spoke to him, it was the speech of anger She shouted at him, it was the shout of heavy guilt: Holy [DN: Inana] gave [DN: Dumuzid] the shepherd into their hands.

Those who had accompanied her, who had come for [DN: Dumuzid], know no food, know no drink, eat no flour offering, drink no libation They never enjoy the pleasures of the marital embrace, never have any sweet children to kiss They snatch the son from a man's knee They make the bride leave the house of her father-in-law.

[DN: Dumuzid] let out a wail and wept The lad raised his hands to heaven, to [DN: Utu]: [DN: Utu], you are my brother-in-law. I am your relation by marriage. I brought butter to your mother's house. I brought milk to [DN: Ningal] house Turn my hands into snake's hands and turn my feet into snake's feet, so I can escape my demons, let them not keep hold of me.

[DN: Utu] accepted his tears. [DN: Dumuzid] demons could not keep hold of him. [DN: Utu] turned [DN: Dumuzid] hands into snake's hands He turned his feet into snake's feet. [DN: Dumuzid] escaped his demons Like a snake he They seized Holy [DN: Inana] her heart.
Holy [DN: Inana] wept bitterly for her husband She tore at her hair like esparto grass, she ripped it out like esparto grass.
A fly spoke to holy [DN: Inana]: Holy [DN: Inana] answered the fly:
The fly helped holy [DN: Inana] Young lady [DN: Inana] decreed the destiny of the fly: Now [DN: Inana] decreed this fate and thus it came to be.
was weeping She came up to the sister and by the hand: Thus holy [DN: Inana] gave [DN: Dumuzid] as a substitute.
[DN: Holy Erekigala] sweet is your praise.
who respects. his departing boat He provided flour, gold and grain, befitting the great lady. this choice grain, the lapis lazuli [DN: Sn-iddinam] [TN: E-kur].

He transported this cargo to the Quay of Life, the quay of [SN: Urim] Joyously he brought it into the majestic house, the house of [DN: Suen]. [DN: Nanna] was delighted with the king, and [DN: Ningal] to him. [DN: Nanna] was delighted with, and [DN: Sn-iddinam] [DN: Ningal] to him The [DN: Anuna], the great gods, blessed him He had brought to complete perfection the plenitude, the pure first-fruit offerings, the first-fruit offerings of the new year He had transported this cargo to the Quay of Life, the quay of [SN: Urim].

[DN: Suen] put in order the food offerings and, after he had taken them to [SN: Nibru], and had brought them into the [TN: E-kur], the house of [DN: Enlil], [DN: Enlil], delighted with the food offerings, fixed a good destiny His own mother, the great lady [DN: Ninlil], expressed deserved affection.

[DN: Suen] addressed [DN: Enlil] and [DN: Ninlil] He prayed to them to determine an eternal destiny for: [DN: Sn-iddinam] whom you favourably address As a just destiny, may a life into the distant future be determined for him in destiny May he be allotted long-lasting life. [DN: Sn-iddinam]

[TN: E-kur] for you, may he hasten thick bread like this threshed grain Let us give him years of favour, days of life and months of success In his palace you will bring to him in perfection what pleases the spirit and gladdens the heart May you be the gift of life for, who discourses pleasingly! May the royal throne rise high and endure eternally! Forever make foreign lands submit to his great name! [DN: Sn-iddinam]

After [DN: Enlil] frown had slain [SN: Ki] as if it were the Bull of Heaven, had slaughtered the house of the land of [SN: Unug] in the dust as if it were a mighty bull, and then [DN: Enlil] had given the rulership and kingship from the south as far as the highlands to [RN: Sargon], king of [SN: Agade] at that time, holy [DN: Inana] established the sanctuary of [SN: Agade] as her celebrated woman's domain; she set up her throne in [SN: Ulma].

Like a young man building a house for the first time, like a girl establishing a woman's domain, holy [DN: Inana] did not sleep as she ensured that the warehouses would be provisioned; that dwellings would be founded in the city; that its people would eat splendid food; that its people would drink splendid beverages; that those bathed for holidays would rejoice in the courtyards; that the people would throng the places of celebration; that acquaintances would dine together; that foreigners would cruise about like unusual birds in the sky; that even [GN: Marhai] would be re-entered on the tribute rolls; that monkeys, mighty elephants, water buffalo, exotic animals, as well as thoroughbred dogs, lions, mountain ibexes mountain beasts horses, and sheep with long wool would jostle each other in the public squares.

She then filled [SN: Agade] stores for emmer wheat with gold, she filled its stores for white emmer wheat with silver; she delivered copper, tin, and blocks of lapis lazuli to its granaries and sealed its silos from outside She endowed its old women with the gift of giving counsel, she endowed its old men with the gift of eloquence She endowed its young women with the gift of entertaining, she endowed its young men with martial might, she endowed its little ones with joy The nursemaids who cared for of the general's children played the drumsticks Inside the city drums sounded; outside it, flutes and instruments Its harbour where ships moored was full of joy All foreign lands rested contentedly, and their people experienced happiness.

Its king, the shepherd [RN: Naram-], rose as the daylight on the holy throne of [DN: Suen] [SN: Agade] Its city wall, like a mountain, a great mountain, reached the heavens It was like the [WN: Tigris] going to flowing into the sea as holy [DN: Inana] opened the portals of its city-gates and made [GN: Sumer] bring its own possessions upstream by boats The highland [GN: Martu], people ignorant of agriculture, brought spirited cattle and kids for her The [EN: Meluans], the people of the black land, brought exotic wares wares of foreign countries up to her. [GN: Elam] and [GN: Subir] loaded themselves with goods for her as if they were packasses All the governors, the temple administrators generals, and the accountants of the [GN: Gu-edina] regularly supplied the monthly and New Year offerings What a weariness all these caused at [SN: Agade] city gates! Holy [DN: Inana] could hardly receive all these offerings As if she were a citizen there, she could not restrain the desire to prepare the ground for a temple.

But the statement coming from the [TN: E-kur] was disquieting Because of [DN: Enlil] all [SN: Agade] was reduced to trembling, and terror befell [DN: Inana] in [SN: Ulma] She left the city, returning to her home Holy [DN: Inana] abandoned the sanctuary of [SN: Agade] like someone abandoning the young women of her woman's domain Like a warrior hurrying to arms, she removed tore away the gift of battle and fight from the city and handed them over to the enemy.

Not even five or 10 days had passed and [DN: Ninurta] brought the jewels of rulership, the royal crown, the emblem and the royal throne bestowed on [SN: Agade], back into his [TN: E-u-me-a]. [DN: Utu] took away the eloquence of the city. [DN: Enki] took away its wisdom. [DN: An] took up out away into the midst of heaven its fearsomeness that reaches heaven. [DN: Enki] tore out its well-anchored holy mooring pole from the. [DN: Inana] took away its weapons.

The life of [SN: Agade] sanctuary was brought to an end as if it had been only the life of a tiny carp in the deep waters, and all the cities were watching it Like a mighty elephant, it bent its neck to the ground while they all raised their horns like mighty bulls Like a dying dragon, it dragged its head on the earth and they jointly deprived it of honour as in a battle.

[RN: Naram-] saw in a nocturnal vision that [DN: Suen] [DN: Enlil] would not let the kingdom of [SN: Agade] occupy a pleasant, lasting residence, that he would make its future altogether unfavourable, that he would make its temples shake and would scatter its treasures destroy its treasuries He realised what the dream was about, but did not put into words, and did not discuss it with anyone. temples shake, perform extispicy regarding his temple Because of the [TN: E-kur], he put on mourning clothes, covered his chariot with a reed mat pulled out the outside pin of his chariot, tore the reed canopy off his ceremonial barge the prow of his ceremonial barge the cabin of his ceremonial barge, and gave away his royal paraphernalia. [RN: Naram-] persisted for seven years! Who has ever seen a king burying his head in his hands for seven years? [DN: Suen] He realised what the dream was about, but did not put into words, and did not discuss it with anyone.

Then he went to perform extispicy on a kid regarding the temple, but the omen had nothing to say about the building of the temple For a second time he went to perform extispicy on a kid regarding the temple, but the omen again had nothing to say about the building of the temple In order to change what had been inflicted upon him, he tried to to alter [DN: Enlil] pronouncement.

Because his subjects were dispersed, he now began a mobilization of his troops Like a wrestler who is about to enter the great courtyard, he his hands towards the [TN: E-kur] Like an athlete bent to start a contest, he treated the as if it were worth only thirty shekels Like a robber plundering the city, he set tall ladders against the temple To demolish [TN: E-kur] as if it were a huge ship, to break up its soil like the soil of mountains where precious metals are mined, to splinter it like the lapis lazuli mountain, to prostrate it like a city inundated by [DN: Ikur] alhough the temple was not the [GN: Mountains of Cedar-felling], he had large axes cast, he had double-edged axes sharpened to be used against it He set spades against its roots and it sank as low as the foundation of the Land He put axes against its top, and the temple, like a dead soldier, bowed its neck before him, and all the foreign lands bowed their necks before him.

He ripped out its drain pipes, and all the rain went back to the heavens He tore off its upper lintel and the Land was deprived of its ornament the ornament of the Land disappeared From its Gate from which Grain is never Diverted, he diverted grain, and the Land was deprived of grain He struck the Gate of Well-Being with the pickaxe, and well-being was subverted in all the foreign lands As if they were for great tracts of land with wide carp-filled waters, he cast large spades axes to be used against the [TN: E-kur] The people could see the bedchamber, its room which knows no daylight The [EN: Akkadians] could look into the holy treasure chest of the gods Though they had committed no sacrilege, its deities of the great pilasters standing at the temple were thrown into the fire by [RN: Naram-] The cedar, cypress, juniper and boxwood, the woods of its [DN: Suen], were by him He put its gold in containers and put its silver in leather bags He filled the docks with its copper, as if it were a huge transport of grain The silversmiths were re-shaping its silver, jewellers were re-shaping its precious stones, smiths were beating its copper Large ships were moored at the temple, large ships were moored at [DN: Enlil] temple and its possessions were taken away from the city, though they were not the goods of a plundered city With the possessions being taken away from the city, good sense left [SN: Agade] As the ships moved away from juddered the docks, [SN: Agade] intelligence sanctuary was removed.

[DN: Enlil], the roaring storm that subjugates the entire land, the rising deluge that cannot be confronted, was considering what should be destroyed in return for the wrecking of his beloved [TN: E-kur] He lifted his gaze towards the [GN: Gubin] mountains, and made all the inhabitants of the broad mountain ranges descend. [DN: Enlil] brought out of the mountains those who do not resemble other people, who are not reckoned as part of the Land, the [EN: Gutians], an unbridled people, with human intelligence but canine instincts feelings and monkeys' features Like small birds they swooped on the ground in great flocks Because of [DN: Enlil], they stretched their arms out across the plain like a net for animals Nothing escaped their clutches, no one left their grasp Messengers no longer travelled the highways, the courier's boat no longer passed along the rivers The [EN: Gutians] drove the trusty goats of [DN: Enlil] out of their folds and compelled their herdsmen to follow them, they drove the cows out of their pens and compelled their cowherds to follow them Prisoners manned the watch Brigands occupied attacked the highways The doors of the city gates of the Land lay dislodged in were covered with mud, and all the foreign lands uttered bitter cries from the walls of their cities They established gardens for themselves made gardens grow within the cities, and not as usual on the wide plain outside As if it had been before the time when cities were built and founded, the large fields and arable tracts yielded no grain, the inundated fields and tracts yielded no fish, the irrigated orchards yielded no syrup or wine, the thick clouds did not rain, the plant did not grow.

In those days, oil for one shekel was only half a litre, grain for one shekel was only half a litre, wool for one shekel was only one mina, fish for one shekel filled only one measure these sold at such prices in the markets of the cities! Those who lay down on the roof, died on the roof; those who lay down in the house were not buried People were flailing at themselves from hunger By the [TN: Ki-ur], [DN: Enlil] great place, dogs were packed together in the silent streets; if two men walked there they would be devoured by them, and if three men walked there they would be devoured by them Noses were punched, heads were smashed, noses were piled up, heads were sown like seeds Honest people were confounded with traitors, heroes lay dead on top of heroes, the blood of traitors ran upon the blood of honest men.

At that time, [DN: Enlil] rebuilt his great sanctuaries into small reed sanctuaries and from east to west he reduced their storehouses The old women who survived those days, the old men who survived those days and the chief lamentation singer who survived those years set up seven drums, as if they stood at the horizon, and together with, and, and and bronze drums made them resound to [DN: Enlil] like [DN: Ikur] for seven days and seven nights The old women did not restrain the cry The old men did not restrain the cry The lamentation singer did not restrain the cry Its young women did not restrain from tearing their hair Its young men did not restrain from sharpening their knives Their laments were as if [TN: E-kur]! [DN: Enlil] ancestors were performing a lament in the awe-inspiring Holy Mound by the holy knees of [DN: Enlil] Because of this, [DN: Enlil] entered his holy bedchamber and lay down fasting.

At that time, [DN: Suen], [DN: Enki], [DN: Inana], [DN: Ninurta], [DN: Ikur], [DN: Utu], [DN: Nuska], and [DN: Nisaba], the great gods all the gods whosoever, cooled sprinkled [DN: Enlil] heart with cool water and prayed to him: [DN: Enlil], may the city that destroyed your city be treated as your city has been treated! May the one that defiled your be treated as [SN: Nibru]! In this city, may heads fill the wells! May no one find his acquaintances there, may brother not recognise brother! May its young woman be cruelly killed in her woman's domain, may its old man cry in distress for his slain wife! May its pigeons moan on their window ledges, may its small birds be smitten in their nooks, may it live in constant anxiety like a timid pigeon!

Again, [DN: Suen], [DN: Enki], [DN: Inana], [DN: Ninurta], [DN: Ikur], [DN: Utu], [DN: Nuska] and [DN: Nisaba], all the gods whosoever, turned their attention to the city, and cursed [SN: Agade] severely: [TN: E-kur]: it is as if you had pounced on [DN: Enlil]! [SN: Agade], you pounced on [TN: E-kur]: it is as if you had pounced on [DN: Enlil]! May your holy walls, to their highest point, resound with mourning! May your be reduced to a pile of dust! May your pilasters with the standing deities fall to the ground like tall young men drunk on wine! May your clay be returned to its, may it be clay cursed by [DN: Enki]! May your grain be returned to its furrow, may it be grain cursed by [DN: Ezina]! May your timber be returned to its forest, may it be timber cursed by [DN: Ninilduma]! May the your cattle slaughterer slaughter his wife, may your the sheep butcher butcher his child! May water wash away your pauper as he is looking for! May your prostitute hang herself at the entrance to her brothel! May your pregnant priestesses and cult prostitutes abort their children! May your gold be bought for the price of silver, may your silver be bought for the price of pyrite, and may your copper be bought for the price of lead!

[SN: Agade], may your strong man be deprived of his strength, so that he will be unable to lift his sack of provisions and, and will not have the joy of controlling your superior asses; may he lie idle all day! May this make the city die of hunger! May your citizens, who used to eat fine food, lie hungry, may your man eat the coating on his roof, may he chew the leather hinges on the main door of his father's house! May depression descend upon your palace, built for joy joyous palace! May the evils of the desert, the silent place, howl continuously!

precinct, established for purification ceremonies! May the, the bird of depression, make its nest in your gateways, established for the Land! In those days, in those distant days, in those nights, in those remote nights, in those years, in those distant years; in days of yore, when the necessary things had been brought into manifest existence, in days of yore, when the necessary things had been for the first time properly cared for, when bread had been tasted for the first time in the shrines of the Land, when the ovens of the Land had been made to work, when the heavens had been separated from the earth, when the earth had been delimited from the heavens, when the fame of mankind had been established, when [DN: An] had taken the heavens for himself, when [DN: Enlil] had taken the earth for himself, when the nether world had been given to [DN: Erekigala] as a gift; when he set sail, when he set sail, when the father set sail for the nether world, when [DN: Enki] set sail for the nether world against the king a storm of small hailstones arose, against [DN: Enki] a storm of large hailstones arose The small ones were light hammers, the large ones were like stones from catapults The keel of [DN: Enki] little boat was trembling as if it were being butted by turtles, the waves at the bow of the boat rose to devour the king like wolves and the waves at the stern of the boat were attacking [DN: Enki] like a lion.

At that time, there was a single tree, a single tree, a single tree, growing on the bank of the pure [WN: Euphrates], being watered by the [WN: Euphrates] The force of the south wind uprooted it and stripped its branches, and the [WN: Euphrates] picked it up and carried it away. A woman, respectful of [DN: An] words, was walking along; a woman, respectful of [DN: Enlil] words, was walking along, and took the tree and brought it into [SN: Unug], into [DN: Inana] luxuriant garden.

The woman planted the tree with her feet, but not with her hands The woman watered it using her feet but not her hands She said: She said: Five years, 10 years went by, the tree grew massive; its bark, however, did not split At its roots, a snake immune to incantations made itself a nest In its branches, the Anzud bird settled its young In its trunk, the phantom maid built herself a dwelling, the maid who laughs with a joyful heart But holy [DN: Inana] cried!

When dawn was breaking, when the horizon became bright, when the little birds, at the break of dawn, began to clamour, when [DN: Utu] had left his bedchamber, his sister holy [DN: Inana] said to the young warrior [DN: Utu]: [DN: An] had taken the heavens for himself, when [DN: Enlil] had taken the earth for himself, when the nether world had been given to [DN: Erekigala] as a gift; when he set sail, when he set sail, when the father set sail for the nether world, when [DN: Enki] set sail for the nether world against the lord a storm of small hailstones arose, against [DN: Enki] a storm of large hailstones arose The small ones were light hammers, the large ones were like stones from catapults The keel of [DN: Enki] little boat was trembling as if it were being butted by turtles, the waves at the bow of the boat rose to devour the lord like wolves and the waves at the stern of the boat were attacking [DN: Enki] like a lion.

He strapped his belt of 50 minas weight to his waist 50 minas were to him as 30 shekels He took his bronze axe used for expeditions, which weighs seven talents and seven minas, in his hand He killed the snake immune to incantations living at its roots The Anzud bird living in its branches took up its young and went into the mountains The phantom maid living in its trunk left her dwelling and sought refuge in the wilderness As for the tree, he uprooted it and stripped its branches, and the sons of his city, who went with him, cut up its branches and bundled them piled them up He gave it to his sister holy [DN: Inana] for her chair He gave it to her for her bed As for himself, from its roots, he manufactured his ball and, from its branches, he manufactured his mallet.

He played with the ball in the broad square, never wanting to stop playing it, and he praised himself in the broad square, never wanting to stop praising himself The young men of his city were playing with the ball For him who made the team of the widows' children, they lamented: For those that had a mother, the mother brought bread for her son; for those that had a sister, the sister poured water for her brother As the evening came, he marked the spot where the ball had been placed, and he picked up his ball from in front of him and took it home But early in the morning as he the place marked, the widows' accusation and the young girls' complaint caused his ball and his mallet to fall down to the bottom of the nether world He could not reach them by He tried with his hand but could not reach touch them, tried with his foot but could not reach touch them.

Heaven copulated with the verdant Earth, [DN: Ninurta]: she has born him a warrior who knows no fear the [DN: Asag], a child who sucked the power of milk without ever staying with a wet-nurse, a foster-child, O my master knowing no father, a murderer from the mountains, a youth who has come forth from, whose face knows no shame; impudent of eye, an arrogant male, [DN: Ninurta] [DN: Ninirsu], rejoicing in his stature My hero, you who are like a bull, I will take my stand beside you My master, who turns sympathetically towards his own city, who is effective in carrying out his mother's wishes: it has sired offspring in the mountains, and spread its seeds far and wide The plants have unanimously named it king over them; like a great wild bull, it tosses its horns amongst them The, the, the (diorite), the, the (haematite), and the heroic stones, its warriors, constantly come raiding the cities For them a shark's tooth has grown up in the mountains; it has stripped the trees Before its might the gods of those cities bow towards it My master, this same creature has erected a throne dais: it is not lying idle. [DN: Ninurta], lord, it actually decides the Land's lawsuits, just as you do Who can compass the [DN: Asag] dread glory? Who can counteract the severity of its frown? People are terrified, fear makes the flesh creep; their eyes are fixed upon it My master, the mountains have taken their offerings to it.

[DN: Enlil], lord, because of your superior strength they are looking to you here; since you are strong, my master, they are calling for your help, saying, [DN: Ninurta], that not a single warrior counts except for you! They wanted to advise you about Hero, there have been consultations with a view to taking away your kingship. [DN: Ninurta], it is confident that it can lay hands on the powers received by you in the Its face is deformed, its location is continually changing; day by day, the [DN: Asag] adds territories to its domain.

[DN: Ninurta], lord, son of [DN: Enlil] Who has so far been able to resist its assault? The besetting [DN: Asag] is beyond all control, its weight is too heavy Rumours of its armies constantly arrive, before ever its soldiers are seen This thing's strength is massive, no weapon has been able to overturn it. [DN: Ninurta], neither the axe nor the all-powerful spear can penetrate its flesh, no warrior like it has ever been created against you Lord, you who reach out towards the august divine powers, splendour, jewel of the gods, you bull with the features of a wild bull, with a prominent backbone, this fellow is clever! My [DN: Ninurta], whose form [DN: Enki] contemplates with favour, my [DN: Uta-ulu], lord, son of [DN: Enlil], what is to be done?

The lord cried so that Heaven trembled, and Earth huddled at his feet and was terrified at his strength. [DN: Enlil] became confused and went out of the [TN: E-kur] The mountains were devastated That day the earth became dark, the [DN: Anuna] trembled The hero beat his thighs with his fists The gods dispersed; the [DN: Anuna] disappeared over the horizon like sheep The lord arose, touching the sky; [DN: Ninurta] went to battle, with one step he covered a league, he was an alarming storm, and rode on the eight winds towards the rebel lands His arms grasped the lance The mace snarled at the mountains, the club began to devour all the enemy He fitted the evil wind and the sirocco on a pole, he placed the quiver on its hook An enormous hurricane, irresistible, went before the hero, stirred up the dust, caused the dust to settle, levelled high and low, filled the holes It caused a rain of coals and flaming fires; the fire consumed men It overturned tall trees by their trunks, reducing the forests to heaps, Earth put her hands on her heart and cried harrowingly; the [WN: Tigris] was muddied, disturbed, cloudy, stirred up He hurried to battle on the boat Ma-kar-nunta-ea; the people there did not know where to turn, they bumped into the walls The birds there tried to lift their heads to fly away, but their wings trailed on the ground The storm flooded out the fish there in the subterranean waters, their mouths snapped at the air It reduced the animals of the open country to firewood, roasting them like locusts It was a deluge rising and disastrously ruining the mountains.

The hero [DN: Ninurta] led the march through the rebel lands He killed their messengers in the mountains, he crushed their cities, he smote their cowherds over the head like fluttering butterflies, he tied together their hands with grass, so that they dashed their heads against walls The lights of the mountains did not gleam in the distance any longer People gasped for breath ; those people were ill, they hugged themselves, they cursed the Earth, they considered the day of the [DN: Asag] birth a day of disaster The lord caused bilious poison to run over the rebel lands As he went the gall followed, anger filled his heart, and he rose like a river in spate and engulfed all the enemies In his heart he beamed at his lion-headed weapon, as it flew up like a bird, trampling the mountains for him It raised itself on its wings to take away prisoner the disobedient, it spun around the horizon of heaven to find out what was happening Someone from afar came to meet it, brought news for the tireless one, the one who never rests, whose wings bear the deluge, the [DN: ar-ur] What did it gather there for Lord [DN: Ninurta] ? It reported the deliberations of the mountains, it explained their intentions to Lord [DN: Ninurta], it outlined what people were saying about the [DN: Asag].
it said concernedly The weapon embraced him whom it loved, the [DN: ar-ur] addressed Lord [DN: Ninurta]:

[DN: Ninurta], king, celestial mace irresistible against the enemy, vigorous one, tempest which rages against the rebel lands, wave which submerges the harvest, king, you have looked on battles, you have in the thick of them. [DN: Ninurta], after gathering the enemy in a battle-net, after erecting a great reed-altar, lord, heavenly serpent, purify your pickaxe and your mace! [DN: Ninurta], I will enumerate the names of the warriors you have already slain: the [DN: Kuli-ana], the [DN: Dragon], the [DN: Gypsum], the [DN: Strong Copper], the hero [DN: Six-headed Wild Ram], the [DN: Magilum Boat], Lord [DN: Saman-ana], the [DN: Bison Bull], the [DN: Palm-tree King], the [DN: Anzud] bird, the [DN: Seven-headed Snake] [DN: Ninurta], you slew them in the mountains.

[DN: Inana] dance! Lord, do not go to such a great battle as this! Do not hurry; fix your feet on the ground. [DN: Ninurta], the [DN: Asag] is waiting for you in the mountains Hero who is so handsome in his crown, firstborn son whom [DN: Ninlil] has decorated with numberless charms, good lord, whom a princess bore to an priest, hero who wears horns like the moon, who is long life for the king of the Land, who opens the sky by great sublime strength, inundation who engulfs the banks, [DN: Ninurta], lord, full of fearsomeness, who will hurry towards the mountains, proud hero without fellow, this time you will not equal the [DN: Asag]! [DN: Ninurta], do not make your young men enter the mountains.

The hero, the son, pride of his father, the very wise, rising from profound deliberation, [DN: Ninurta], the lord, the son of [DN: Enlil], gifted with broad wisdom, the god, the lord stretched his leg to mount the onager, and joined the battalions He spread over the mountains his great long, he caused to go out among its people like the He reached He went into the rebel lands in the vanguard of the battle He gave orders to his lance, and attached it by its cord; the lord commanded his mace, and it went to its belt The hero hastened to the battle, he heaven and earth He prepared the throw-stick and the shield, the mountains were smitten and cringed beside the battle legions of [DN: Ninurta] When the hero was girding on his mace, the sun did not wait, the moon went in; they were forgotten, as he marched towards the mountains; the day became like pitch.

The [DN: Asag] leapt up at the head of the battle For a club it uprooted the sky, took it in its hand; like a snake it slid its head along the ground It was a mad dog attacking to kill the helpless, dripping with sweat on its flanks Like a wall collapsing, the [DN: Asag] fell on [DN: Ninurta], the son of [DN: Enlil] Like an accursed storm, it howled in a raucous voice; like a gigantic snake, it roared at the Land It dried up the waters of the mountains, dragged away the tamarisks, tore the flesh of the Earth and covered her with painful wounds It set fire to the reedbeds, bathed the sky in blood, turned it inside out; it dispersed the people there At that moment, on that day, the fields became black scum, across the whole extent of the horizon, reddish like purple dye truly it was so! [DN: An] was overwhelmed, crouched, wrung his hands against his stomach; [DN: Enlil] groaned and hid himself in a corner, the [DN: Anuna] flattened themselves against walls, the house was full of fearful sighing as of pigeons The Great Mountain [DN: Enlil] cried to Ninlil:
[TN: E-kur], the king who imposes the strong shackle for his father, a cedar rooted in the, a crown with broad shade, my son, my security he is not here any more: who will take me by the hand?

The weapon which loved the lord, obedient to its master, the [DN: ar-ur] for Lord [DN: Ninurta] to his father in [SN: Nibru] The awesome splendour enveloped [DN: Ninurta] like a garment. bound him: therefore the lord The weapon spoke to [DN: Enlil].

[DN: Ninurta], having confidence in himself; he will be standing; the waters will be dried up as if by the sun's heat; he will breathe again, he will be standing full of joy. I shall cause horrid storms to rise against of the hero [DN: Ninurta]. as for him who resisted the mountains, he has been amazed by his strength Now I shall give my orders, you are to follow these instructions: [DN: Enlil], have decreed.
The weapon, its heart, was reassured: it slapped its thighs, the [DN: ar-ur] began to run, it entered the rebel lands, joyfully it reported the message to Lord [DN: Ninurta]:

[DN: Enlil] has said: You, lord who trusts in the word of his father, do not tarry, great strength of, before whom the venom has piled up, attacks the enemy, let him take the [DN: Ninurta] [DN: Asag] by the shoulder, let him pierce its liver, let my son enter with it into the [TN: E-kur] Then, [DN: Ninurta], to the limits of the earth my people will deservedly praise your power. [DN: Enlil] Storm of the rebel lands, who grinds the mountains like flour, [DN: Ninurta], [DN: Enlil] seal-bearer, go to it! Do not tarry My master: the [DN: Asag] has constructed a wall of stakes on an earthen rampart; the fortress is too high and cannot be reached, its fierceness does not diminish.
[DN: Ninurta] opened his mouth to speak to the mace He aimed the lance at the mountains The lord stretched out an arm towards the clouds Day became a dark night He yelled like a storm.

The lord the wind In his battle he smote the mountains with a cudgel The [DN: ar-ur] made the storm-wind rise to heaven, scattering the people; like it tore Its spittle alone destroyed the townspeople The destructive mace set fire to the mountains, the murderous weapon smashed skulls with its painful teeth, the club which tears out entrails piled up noses The lance was stuck into the ground and the crevasses filled with blood In the rebel lands dogs licked it up like milk The enemy rose up, crying to wife and child, The weapon covered the mountains with dust, but did not shake the heart of the [DN: Ninurta]. [DN: Asag] The [DN: ar-ur] threw its arms around the neck of the lord:

he said quietly. [DN: Ninurta], lord, son of [DN: Enlil], I tell you again, it is made like a storm It is a blister whose smell is foul, like mucus which comes from the nose it is unpleasant, lord, its words are devious, it will not obey you My master, it has been created against you as a god; who can help you? Hero, it falls on the land as a whirlwind, it scrubs it as if with saltwort, [DN: Ninurta], it chases the onagers before it in the mountains Its terrifying splendour sends the dust into clouds, it causes a downpour of potsherds In the rebel lands it is a lion striking with savage teeth; no man can catch it After reducing everything to nothing in the north wind, that one will batter you The sheepfolds have been closed by ghostly demons It has dried up the waters in the ground In the whirlwind storm, the people are finished, they have no solution From an implacable enemy, great hero, lord, turn away,

But the lord howled at the mountains, could not withhold a roar The hero did not address the rebel lands, he He reversed the evil that it had done He smashed the heads of all the enemies, he made the mountains weep The lord ranged about in all directions, like a soldier saying Like a bird of prey the [DN: Asag] looked up angrily from the mountains He commanded the rebel lands to be silent and. [DN: Ninurta] approached the enemy and flattened him like a wave The [DN: Asag] terrifying splendour was contained, it began to fade, it began to fade It looked wonderingly upwards Like water he agitated it, he scattered it into the mountains, like esparto grass he pulled it up, like esparto grass he ripped it up. [DN: Ninurta] splendour covered the Land, he pounded the [DN: Asag] like roasted barley, he its genitals, he piled it up like a heap of broken bricks, he heaped it up like flour, as a potter does with coals; he piled it up like stamped earth whose mud has been dredged The hero had achieved his heart's desire. [DN: Ninurta], the lord, the son of [DN: Enlil], began to calm down.

In the mountains, the day came to an end The sun bade it farewell The lord his belt and mace in water, he washed the blood from his clothes, the hero wiped his brow, he made a victory-chant over the dead body When he had brought the [DN: Asag] which he had slain to the condition of a ship wrecked by a tidal wave, the gods of the Land came to him Like exhausted wild asses they prostrated themselves before him, and for this lord, because of his proud conduct, for [DN: Ninurta], the son of [DN: Enlil], they clapped their hands in greeting The [DN: ar-ur] addressed these flattering words aloud to its master to Lord [DN: Ninurta]:

tree in a watered field, hero, who is like you? My master, beside you there is no one else, nor can anyone stand like you, nor is anyone born like you. [DN: Ninurta], from today no one in the mountains will rise against you My master, if you give but one roar, how they will praise you! [DN: Ninurta] After he had pulled up the [DN: Asag] like esparto grass in the rebel lands, torn it up like esparto grass, Lord [DN: Ninurta] his club: [DN: Asag]: its name shall be Stone Its name shall be stone, its name shall be Stone This, its entrails, shall be the underworld Its valour shall belong to the lord.
The blessing of the club, laid to rest in a corner: 'The mighty battle which reduces the Land'.

At that time, the good water coming forth from the earth did not pour down over the fields The cold water was piled up everywhere, and the day when it began to it brought destruction in the mountains, since the gods of the Land were subject to servitude, and had to carry the hoe and the basket this was their corve work people called on a household for the recruitment of workers The [WN: Tigris] did not bring up its flood in its fullness Its mouth did not finish in the sea, it did not carry fresh water No one brought offerings to the market The famine was hard, as nothing had yet been born No one yet cleaned the little canals, the mud was not dredged up No one yet drew water for the fertile fields, ditch-making did not exist People did not work in furrows, barley was sown broadcast.

The lord applied his great wisdom to it. [DN: Ninurta] [DN: Ninirsu], the son of [DN: Enlil], set about it in a grand way He made a pile of stones in the mountains Like a floating cloud he stretched out his arms over it With a great wall he barred the front of the Land He installed a sluice on the horizon The hero acted cleverly, he dammed in the cities together He blocked the powerful waters by means of stones Now the waters will never again go down from the mountains into the earth That which was dispersed he gathered together Where in the mountains scattered lakes had formed, he joined them all together and led them down to the [WN: Tigris] He poured carp-floods of water over the fields.

Now, today, throughout the whole world, kings of the Land far and wide rejoice at Lord [DN: Ninurta] He provided water for the speckled barley in the cultivated fields, he raised up piled up the harvest of fruits in garden and orchard He heaped up the grain piles like mounds The lord caused trading colonies to go up from the Land of [GN: Sumer] He contented the desires of the gods They duly praised [DN: Ninurta] father.

At that time he also reached a woman with compassion. [DN: Ninma] was sleepless from remembering the place where she had conceived him She covered her outside with a fleece, like an unshorn ewe, she made a great lament about the now inaccessible mountains:

thus the good lady said as she went to him in [DN: Enlil], whose head is worthy of the tiara, who knows nothing of: in triumph he hurried by me, he with whom my husband made me pregnant. I bore him for my husband He was close ; but the son of [DN: Enlil] passed by and did not lift his glance to me For the good youth [TN: E-u-me-a], his chosen place [DN: Enlil] judge, the great hero, favoured by his father.
The lady performed the song in a holy manner. [DN: Ninma] recited it to Lord [DN: Ninurta] He looked at her with his life-giving looks and spoke to her:

[DN: Ninma] ('Great Lady'), since you entered the rebel lands for my sake, since you did not keep far from me when I was surrounded by the horrors of battle let the name of the pile which I, the hero, have piled up be 'Mountain' ( ) and may you be its lady ( ): now that is the destiny decreed by [DN: Ninurta] Henceforth people shall speak of [DN: Ninursaa] So be it Let its meadows produce herbs for you Let its slopes produce honey and wine for you Let its hillsides grow cedars, cypress, juniper and box for you Let it make abundant for you ripe fruits, as a garden Let the mountain supply you richly with divine perfumes Let it mine gold and silver for you, make for you Let it smelt copper and tin for you, make its tribute for you Let the mountains make wild animals teem for you Let the mountain increase the fecundity of quadrupeds for you You, O Queen, become equal to [DN: An], wearing a terrifying splendour Great goddess who detests boasting, good lady, maiden [DN: Ninursaa], [DN: Nintur], approach me Lady, I have given you great powers: may you be exalted.

While the lord was fixing the destiny of the mountains, as he walked about in the sanctuary of [SN: Nibru], the good lady whose powers excel all powers, Lady-creatrix-of-the-womb, [DN: Aruru], [DN: Enlil] elder sister, stood before him:
The lord then addressed the stone He defined its typical behaviour The lord spoke to it in anger in the Land. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] cursed it:

stone (emery), since you rose against me in the mountains, since you barred the way seized me so as to detain me, since you swore to put me to death, since you frightened me, Lord [DN: Ninurta], on my great throne; you are powerful, a youth of outstanding strength: may your size be diminished. A mighty lion, confident in its strength, will tear you into pieces, the strong man will fling you in his hand in combat for strength Young stone, your brothers will heap you up like flour You will lift your hand against your offspring, sink your teeth into their corpses You, young man, though you may cry out, will end as Like a great wild bull killed by many people, be divided into portions. stone, you will be hounded from the battlefield with clubs, like a dog chased by shepherd boys Because I am the lord: since cornelian is polished by you, you shall be called by its name And now, according to the destiny fixed by [DN: Ninurta], henceforth when stone touches it, there will be pierced cornelian Let it be so.
The hero addressed the and stones The lord enumerated their characteristics. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed their destiny:

stones, since you attacked against my weapons; stones, since you stood fiercely against me like bulls, since you tossed your horns in the dust at me like wild bulls, you shall be like butterflies My terrifying splendour will cover you Since you cannot escape from my his great strength, the goldsmith shall puff and blow on you with his breath You shall be shaped by him to form a matrix for his creations People shall place the first fruits of the gods on you at the time of the new moon.
My king stood before the stone, he addressed the and stones. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed their destiny:

stone, since you flew up against me ; stone, since you sparked lightning against me ; stone, since you shook your head at me, since you ground your teeth at me, the lord! The stone will smash you, stone, young brave, and the stone will destroy ( ) you You will be discarded as contemptible and valueless ( ) Be a prey to the famine ( ) of the Land; you shall be fed by the charity of your city You shall be accounted a common person, a warrior among slave-girls They shall say to you, it shall be your name And now, by the destiny fixed by [DN: Ninurta], henceforth you shall be called a bad lot in the Land So be it.
My king stood before the stone. he spoke in hymnic language. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed its destiny:

(diorite), your army in battle changed sides separately You spread before me like thick smoke You did not raise your hand You did not attack me Since you said, they shall extract you from the highland countries They shall bring you from the land of [DN: Ninurta], the son of [DN: Enlil] ? [GN: Magan] You shall shape [DN: Strong Copper] like leather and then you shall be perfectly adapted for my heroic arm, for me, the lord When a king who is establishing his renown for perpetuity has had its statues sculpted for all time, you shall be placed in the place of libations and it shall suit you well in my temple [TN: E-ninnu], the house full of grace.
My king turned to the stone He the body from the stone. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] cursed it:

; stones, since you bewitched my powers lie down there, you, to be worked on like a pig Be discarded, be used for nothing, end up by being reduced to tiny fragments He who knows you shall reduce you to liquid.
My king turned to the stone. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed its destiny:

, intelligently you caused terror of me to descend on the mountains where discord had broken out In the rebel lands you proclaimed my name among my people who had banded together Nothing of your wholeness shall be diminished It shall be difficult to reduce your mass to small pieces My divine ordinances shall be set out in straight lines on your body You shall be greatly suited to the clash of weapons, when I have heroes to slay You shall be set up on a pedestal in my great courtyard The Land shall praise you in wonder, the foreign lands shall speak your praise elevate you.
The hero turned to the (haematite) stone, he addressed it for its hardness. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed its destiny:

, when the demands of the rebel lands reached you, I did not conquer you. I did not notice you among the hostile ones. I shall make room for you in the Land The divine rites of [DN: Utu] shall become your powers Be constituted as a judge in the foreign lands The craftsman, expert in everything, shall value you as if gold Young man of whom I have taken possession, because of you I shall not sleep until you come to life And now, according to the destiny fixed by [DN: Ninurta], henceforth shall live! So shall it be.
The hero stood before the (alabaster) stone. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed its destiny:

, whose body shines like the daylight! Purified silver, youth destined for the palace, since you alone held out your hands to me, and you prostrated yourself before me in your mountains, I did not smite you with the club, and I did not turn my strength against you Hero, you stood firm by me when I yelled out Your name shall be called benevolence The treasury of the Land shall be subject to your hand, you shall be its seal-keeper The [DN: Anuna].
My king turned to the stone and frowned The lord spoke to it angrily in the Land. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] cursed it:
, you shall be the regular sacrifice offered daily by the smiths.

My king turned to the stone He addressed the, the (cornelian) and the (lapis lazuli); the, the, the, the and the ; the, the, the and the stones, the and the stones Lord [DN: Ninurta], son of [DN: Enlil], fixed their destinies for the waterskin:

, shall be chosen for syrup and for wine You shall all be decorated with precious metal The principal among the gods shall cause the foreign lands to prostrate themselves before you, putting their noses to the ground.
My king turned to the (flint), and frowned The lord spoke to it angrily in the Land. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] cursed it:

, what then? They shall split your horns, wild bull, in your mountains Lie down before the You were not equal to me who supported you. I shall rip you like a sack, and people will smash you into tiny pieces The metalworker shall deal with you, he shall use his chisel on you Young man, massive, bearer of hatred: the carpenter, saying, shall wet you with water and shall crush you like malt.
My king turned to the stones, he addressed the stones. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed their destiny:

stones, in the mountains you cried out against me You fiercely uttered battle-yells. I shall enflame you like fire Like a storm I shall overturn you. I shall strip you like esparto grass. I shall rip you up like esparto grass Who will assist you then? stone: your cries shall not be valued, no attention shall be paid to them. stone, stone: your path shall not lead to the palace.
My king turned to the stone He addressed the and stones. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] defined their characteristic behaviour:

stone, stone, blazing fires; stone, which nothing resists; when the stone and you were set ablaze, you burnt against me in the rebel lands like a brazier Since you all stood against me in the land of [GN: Saba]: stone, they shall slaughter you like a sheep. stone, they shall crunch you for pulverising. stone, they shall sharpen you for the battle-mace; with bronze, the arrowheads of the gods, they shall smash you with the axe, stinging with fierce swords.
My king turned to the stone. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed its destiny:

stone, who smash your head against anyone travelling alone in the desert, in the mountains when my arms were occupied you tried to trample on me Since you glutted yourself in the battle, the reed-worker shall make the reeds jump with you You shall be thrown onto your couch; the appearance of your mother and father who bore you shall be forgotten No one shall say to you, no one shall have the feeling that he misses you, the people shall not complain about your loss In praise of the eternally-created powers in [DN: Ninursaa] resting place, you shall be discarded on the dais there They shall feed you on malt, as they do for sheep; you shall content yourself with a portion of scattered flour This shall be the explanation for you.
My king turned to the stone. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] pronounced its destiny.

, the string in my place, you were taken, since you did not participate in the crimes of your city, ; you shall be the bowl under the filter-jug, the water shall filter into you. you shall be used for inlay-work You shall be the perfect ornament for sacred brooches. you shall be duly praised in the temples of the gods.
The hero turned to the stone and frowned In the Land the lord addressed it angrily. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] pronounced its destiny:

stone, you cried out against me in the mountains You yelled fiercely with wild battle-yells With your yelling, you fixed a demon in the mountains Young man, because of your digging, Ditch ( ) shall be your name And now, according to the destiny of [DN: Ninurta], henceforth they shall say So be it.
My king turned to the stone. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed its destiny:

stone, holy garment of mourning, blinded youth whom people carve, in the mountains you prostrated yourself before me Since you said to me, your name shall be magnified of its own accord wherever it is mentioned As the connoisseur says of precious metal, [DN: Ninurta], so the foreign nations, like musicians playing the reed-pipe, shall pursue you.
My king turned to the stone, he addressed the and stones For the, the, the, the, the and the stones. [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil] fixed their destiny:
The hero turned to the stone He addressed the stone Lord [DN: Ninurta], son of [DN: Enlil], fixed the destiny for the yellow-coloured (kohl):
, He assigned them to the cult of [DN: Ninursaa].

The hero had conquered the mountains As he moved across the desert, he Through the crowd, he came forth among their acclamations, majestically he. [DN: Ninurta] joyfully went to his beloved barge, the lord set foot in the boat Ma-kar-nunta-ea The boatmen sang a pleasant song, for the lord they sang his praise They addressed an eternal greeting to [DN: Ninurta] son of [DN: Enlil]:

[DN: Ninurta], king of the [DN: Anuna] gods, holding a cudgel in his right hand, bearded, you fall as a torrent on all enemies; who can rival your great works? Hero, deluge, without equal, the and [DN: Enki] deities dare not resist you Hero who pillages the cities, who subjugates the mountains, son of [DN: Ninki] [DN: Enlil], who will rise up against you? [DN: Ninurta], lord, son of [DN: Enlil], hero, who is like you?
[DN: An] heart be appeased for the lord, may the maiden, Mother [DN: Bau], shine like the daylight for [DN: Ninurta], [DN: Enlil] strength.
