There was a levy for him on the clans of [DN: Ninirsu] "Rampant fierce bull which has no opponent" and "White cedars surrounding their master", and he placed [DN: Lugal-kur-dub], their magnificent standard, in front of them.

There was a levy for him on the clan of [DN: Nane] "Both river banks and shores rising out of the waters, the huge river, full of water, which spreads its abundance everywhere", and he placed the holy pelican, the standard of [DN: Nane], in front of them.

There was a levy for him on the clans of [DN: Inana] "The net suspended for catching the beasts of the steppe" and "Choice steeds, famous team, the team beloved by [DN: Utu] ", and he placed the rosette, the standard of [DN: Inana], in front of them.
In order to build the house of [DN: Ninirsu],

The [EN: Elamites] came to him from [GN: Elam], the [EN: Susians] came to him from [GN: Susa]. [GN: Magan] and [GN: Melua] loaded wood from their mountains upon their shoulders for him, and to build the house of [DN: Ninirsu], they gathered for [RN: Gudea] at his city [SN: irsu].

[DN: Ninzaga] was commanded and he made his copper, as much as if it were a huge grain transport, reach [RN: Gudea], the man in charge of building the house. [DN: Ninsikila] was also instructed and she made large logs, ebony, and wood reach the ruler building the [TN: E-ninnu].

Lord [DN: Ninirsu] directed [RN: Gudea] into the impenetrable mountain of cedars and he cut down its cedars with great axes and carved the ar-ur, the right arm of [SN: Laga], his master's flood-storm weapon, out of it.

It was like a giant serpent floating on the water as, for Lord [DN: Ninirsu], [RN: Gudea] had the long rafts floating downstream moor at the main quay of Kan-sura: logs of cedar wood from the cedar hills, logs of cypress wood from the cypress hills, logs of wood from the hills, tall spruce trees, plane trees, and trees.

Lord [DN: Ninirsu] directed [RN: Gudea] into the impenetrable mountains of stones and he brought back great stones in the form of slabs For Lord [DN: Ninirsu], [RN: Gudea] had ships with dock there, and ships with gravel, with dried bitumen, bitumen, and gypsum from the hills of [GN: Madga], cargoes like boats bringing grain from the fields.

Great things came to the succour of the ruler building the [TN: E-ninnu]: a copper mountain in [GN: Kima] revealed itself to him He mined its copper onto rafts To the man in charge of building his master's house, the ruler, gold was brought in dust form from its mountains For [RN: Gudea] refined silver was brought down from its mountains Translucent cornelian from [GN: Melua] was spread before him From the alabaster mountains alabaster was brought down to him.

The shepherd was going to build the house with silver, so he sat together with silversmiths He was going to build the [TN: E-ninnu] with precious stone, so he sat with jewellers He was going to build it with copper and tin, so the mother-goddess of the Land directed before him the chief of the smiths.
The heavy hammer-stones roared for him like a storm The dolerite, the light hammer-stones, two three. like a huge mass of water gushing forth,
He the days. [RN: Gudea] prolonged the nights for [DN: Ninirsu] Because of building the house for his master, he neither slept at night, nor did he rest his head during the siesta.

For the one looked on with favour by [DN: Nane], for the favourite of [DN: Enlil], for the ruler by [DN: Ninirsu], for [RN: Gudea], born in the august sanctuary by [DN: atumdug], [DN: Nisaba] opened the house of understanding and [DN: Enki] put right the design of the house.

Towards the house whose halo reaches to heaven, whose powers embrace heaven and earth, whose owner is a lord with a fierce stare, whose warrior [DN: Ninirsu] is expert at battle, towards [TN: E-ninnu-the-white-Anzud-bird], [RN: Gudea] went from the south and admired it northwards From the north he went towards it and admired it southwards He measured out with rope exactly one He drove in pegs at its sides and personally verified them This made him extremely happy.

When the night fell, he went to the old temple to pray, so that the inclination of would become favourable for [DN: Ninirsu] [RN: Gudea] When day broke, he took a bath and arranged his outfit correctly. [DN: Utu] let abundance come forth for him. [RN: Gudea] left [SN: Iri-kug] a second time; he sacrificed a perfect bull and a perfect kid He went to the house and saluted it.

He the holy basket and true fated brick mould the [TN: E-ninnu] As he and walked proudly, [DN: Lugal-kur-dub] walked in front of him, [DN: Ig-alim] directed him and [DN: Ninizida], his personal god, held him by the hand throughout the time.

He poured clear water into the of the brick mould, and drums were playing for the ruler He prepared the excavated earth for making the brick, and hoed honey, ghee and precious oil into it He worked balsam and essences from all kinds of trees into the paste He lifted up the holy carrying-basket and put it next to the brick mould. [RN: Gudea] placed the clay into the brick mould and acted exactly as prescribed, bringing the first brick of the house into existence in it, while all the bystanders sprinkled oil or cedar perfume His city and the land of [SN: Laga] spent the day with him in joy.

He shook the brick mould and left the brick to dry He looked at the with satisfaction He anointed it with cypress essence and balsam. [DN: Utu] rejoiced over the brick put into the mould by [RN: Gudea], and King [DN: Enki] the rising like a great river. and [RN: Gudea] went into the house.

He raised the brick out of the of the mould, and it looked as a holy crown worn by [DN: An] He lifted up the brick and went around among his people: it was like [DN: Utu] holy team tossing their heads The brick lifting its head toward the house was as if [DN: Nanna] cows were eager to be tethered in their pen He put down the brick, entered the house and as if he himself were [DN: Nisaba] knowing the inmost secrets of numbers, he started setting down the ground plan of the house As if he were a young man building a house for the first time, sweet sleep never came into his eyes Like a cow keeping an eye on its calf, he went in constant worry to the house Like a man who takes but little food into his mouth, he went around untiringly The intention of his master had become clear for him, the words of [DN: Ninirsu] had become as conspicuous as a banner to [RN: Gudea] In his heart beating loudly because of building the house, someone a propitious ominous remark This made him extremely happy.

He performed extispicy on a kid and his omen was favourable He cast grain on to and its appearance was right. [RN: Gudea] lay down for a dream oracle, and while he was sleeping a message came to him: in the vision he saw his master's house already built, the [TN: E-ninnu] separating heaven and earth This made him extremely happy.

He stretched out lines in the most perfect way; he set up a sanctuary in the holy In the house, [DN: Enki] drove in the foundation pegs, while [DN: Nane], the daughter of [SN: Eridug], took care of the oracular messages The mother of [SN: Laga], holy [DN: atumdug], gave birth to its bricks amid cries, and [DN: Bau], the lady, first-born daughter of [DN: An], sprinkled them with oil and cedar essence. and priests were detailed to the house to provide maintenance for it The [DN: Anuna] gods stood there full of admiration.

[RN: Gudea], in charge of building the house, placed on his head the carrying-basket for the house, as if it were a holy crown He laid the foundation, set the walls on the ground He marked out a square, aligned the bricks with a string He marked out a second square on the site of the temple, saying, He marked out a third square on the site of the temple, saying, capacity He marked out a fourth square on the site of the temple, saying, He marked out a fifth square on the site of the temple, saying, He marked out a sixth square on the site of the temple, saying, He marked out a seventh square on the site of the temple, saying, [TN: E-ninnu] bathing the Land with moonlight at dawn.

They inserted the wooden door frames, which were like a crown worn in the blue sky As [RN: Gudea] sat down at a wooden door frame, from there it was like a huge house embracing heaven As he built the house and laid wooden scaffolding against it, it was like [DN: Nanna] lagoon attended by [DN: Enki] They made the house grow as high as the hills, they mad it float in the midst of heaven as a cloud, they made it lift its horns as a bull and they made it raise its head above all the lands, like the tree over the As the house had been made to lift its head so high as to fill the space between heaven and earth like the hills, it was like a luxuriant cedar growing among high grass ; [TN: E-ninnu] was decorated most alluringly among [GN: Sumer] buildings.

As they placed wooden beams on the house, they looked like dragons of the coming out all together, they were like of heaven, they were like huge serpents of the foothills The reeds cut for the house were like mountain snakes sleeping together Its upper parts were covered with luxuriant cedar and cypress, and they put white cedars in its inner room of cedar, marvellous to behold They treated them with good perfume and precious oil The mud-wall of the house was covered with the abundance of the and they tied its to it The shrine of [TN: E-ninnu] was thus placed in the hand of [DN: An].

The ruler built the house, he made it high, high as a great mountain Its foundation pegs, big mooring stakes, he drove into the ground so deep they could take counsel with [DN: Enki] in the [TN: E-engura] He had heavenly foundation pegs surround the house like warriors, so that each one was drinking water at the libation place of the gods He fixed the [TN: E-ninnu], the mooring stake, he drove in its pegs shaped like praying wizards He planted the pleasant poplars of his city so that they cast their shadow He embedded its ar-ur weapon beside [SN: Laga] like a big standard, placed it in its dreadful place, the u-galam, and made it emanate fearsome radiance On the dais of ir-nun, on the place of making judgments, the provider of [SN: Laga] lifted his horns like a mighty bull.

It took one year to bring the great stones in slabs and it took another year to fashion them, although not even two or three days did he let pass idly Then it needed a day's work to set up each one but by the seventh day he had set them all up around the house He laid down the trimmings from the slabs as stairs, or fashioned basins from them, and had them stand in the house.
The stela which he set up in the great courtyard he named as "The king who the courtyard, Lord [DN: Ninirsu], has recognised [RN: Gudea] from the ir-nun".
The stela which he set up at the Kan-sura gate he named as "The king, [DN: Enlil] flood storm, who has no opponent, Lord [DN: Ninirsu], has looked with favour at [RN: Gudea] ".
The stela which he set up facing the rising sun he named as "The king, the roaring storm of [DN: Enlil], the lord without rival, Lord [DN: Ninirsu], has chosen [RN: Gudea] with his holy heart".
The stela which he set up facing u-galam he named as "The king, at whose name the foreign countries tremble, Lord [DN: Ninirsu], has made [RN: Gudea] throne firm".
The stela which he set up facing [TN: E-uru-ga] he named as "Lord [DN: Ninirsu] has decided a good fate for [RN: Gudea] ".
The stela which he set up by the inner room of [DN: Bau] he named as "The eyes of [DN: An] know the [TN: E-ninnu], and [DN: Bau] is the life source of [RN: Gudea] ".

He built his master's house exactly as he had been told to The true shepherd [RN: Gudea] made it grow so high as to fill the space between heaven and earth, had it wear a tiara shaped like the new moon, and had its fame spread as far as the heart of the highlands. [RN: Gudea] made [DN: Ninirsu] house come out like the sun from the clouds, had it grow to be like hills of lapis lazuli and had it stand to be marvelled at like hills of white alabaster.

He made its door-sockets stand like wild bulls and he flanked them with dragons crouching on their paws like lions He had its terraced tower grow on a place as pure as the He made the metal tops of its standards twinkle as the horns of the holy stags of the. [RN: Gudea] made the house of [DN: Ninirsu] stand to be marvelled at like the new moon in the skies.

The built-in door-sockets of the house are deities standing by the Its timber store looks like waves of an enormous lagoon where snakes have dived into the water Its is full of fearsomeness Its is a light floating in the midst of heaven On the Gate where the King Enters an eagle is raising its eyes toward a wild bull Its curved wooden posts joining above the gate are a rainbow stretching over the sky Its upper lintel of the gate like the [TN: E-ninnu] stands among rumbling, roaring storms Its awe-inspiring eyebrow-shaped arch meets the admiring eyes of the gods His white dais of the house is a firmly founded lapis lazuli mountain connecting heaven and earth.

They installed the great dining hall for the evening meals: it was as if [DN: An] himself were setting out golden bowls filled with honey and wine They built the bedchamber: it is the 's fruit-bearing holy tree among innumerable mountains He finished with the building, which made the hearts of the gods overflow with joy.

The true shepherd [RN: Gudea] is wise, and able too to realise things In the inner room where the weapons hang, at the Gate of Battle he had the warriors Six-headed wild ram and head take their stand Facing the city, its place laden with awe, he had the Seven-headed serpent take its stand In u-galam, its awesome gate, he had the Dragon and the Date palm take their stand Facing the sunrise, where the fates are decided, he erected the standard of [DN: Utu], the Bison head, beside others already there At the Kan-sura gate, at its lookout post, he had the Lion, the terror of the gods, take its stand In the [TN: Tar-sirsir], where the orders are issued, he had the Fish-man and the Copper take their stand In [DN: Bau] inner room, where the heart can be soothed, he had the Magilum boat and the Bison take their stand Because these were warriors slain by [DN: Ninirsu], he set their mouths towards libation places. [RN: Gudea], the ruler of [SN: Laga], made their names appear among those of the gods.

The cedar doors installed in the house are [DN: Ikur] roaring above The locks of the [TN: E-ninnu] are bisons, its door-pivots are lions, from its bolts horned vipers and fierce snakes are hissing at wild bulls Its jambs, against which the door leaves close, are young lions and panthers lying on their paws.

The shining roof-beam nails hammered into the house are dragons gripping a victim The shining ropes attached to the doors are holy [DN: Nira] parting the Its is pure like [SN: Ke] and [SN: Aratta], its is a fierce lion keeping an eye on the Land; nobody going alone can pass in front of it.

The fearsomeness of the [TN: E-ninnu] covers all the lands like a garment The house! It is founded by [DN: An] on refined silver, it is painted with kohl, and comes out as the moonlight with heavenly splendour The house! Its front is a great mountain firmly grounded, its inside resounds with incantations and harmonious hymns, its exterior is the sky, a great house rising in abundance, its outer assembly hall is the [DN: Anuna] gods' place of rendering judgments, from its words of prayer can be heard, its food supply is the abundance of the gods, its standards erected around the house are the Anzud bird spreading its wings over the bright mountain. [TN: E-ninnu] clay plaster, harmoniously blended clay taken from the [WN: Edin] canal, has been chosen by its master Lord [DN: Ninirsu] with his holy heart, and was painted by [RN: Gudea] with the splendours of heaven as if kohl were being poured all over it.

From its cow-pen butter and milk are brought in From its huge oven, great cakes and croissants come Its feeds cattle and sheep Its house of food rations an shrine Its wine-cellar is a mountain oozing wine, from its brewery as much beer comes as the [WN: Tigris] at high water.

Its storehouse is full of gems, silver and tin Its coach-house is a mountain set on the ground Its drum hall is a roaring bull Its courtyard resounds with holy prayers, and drums Its stone stairs, laid before the house, are like a mountain range lying down in princely joy Its upper stairs leading to the roof are like a light clearly visible as far as the mountains Its vineyard "Black garden in the steppe", planted near the house, is a mountain oozing wine and grows in a place with fearsomeness and radiance.

The seven stones surrounding the house are there to take counsel with its owner Its chapel for funerary offerings is as pure as the clean The stone basins set up in the house are like the holy room of the lustration priest where water never ceases to flow Its high battlements where pigeons live is [SN: Eridug]. [TN: E-ninnu] offers rest to pigeons, it is a protective cover with large branches and a pleasant shade, with swallows and other birds chirping loudly there It is [DN: Enlil] [TN: E-kur] when a festival takes place in it The house's great awesomeness settles upon the whole Land, its praise reaches to the highlands, the awesomeness of the [TN: E-ninnu] covers all lands like a garment.
The house has been built most sumptuously by its lord It was built on a pedestal by [DN: Ninizida] Its foundation pegs were driven in by [RN: Gudea], the ruler of [SN: Laga].

For the restoration of [TN: E-ninnu], the house that rises like the sun over the Land, stands like a great bull in the sand, illuminates the assembly like delightful moonlight, is as sumptuous as lush green foothills, and stands to be marvelled at, praise be to [DN: Ninirsu]!
This is the middle of the hymn "The building of [DN: Ninirsu] house".

House, mooring post of the Land, grown so high as to fill the space between heaven and earth, [TN: E-ninnu], the true brickwork, for which [DN: Enlil] determined a good fate, green hill standing to be marvelled at, standing out above all the lands!
The house is a great mountain reaching up to the skies It is [DN: Utu] filling the midst of the heavens; [TN: E-ninnu] is the white Anzud bird spreading its talons upon the mountain land.

All the people were placed before it, the whole Land was detailed to it The [DN: Anuna] gods stood there in admiration The ruler, who is wise, who is knowledgeable, kissed the ground before that godly company He touched the ground in prostration, with supplications and prayers; the ruler, the god of his city prayed.
For the bread-consuming house he added more and more bread, for the suppers in need of mutton he added sheep In front of the house he lined up bowls like abundance.

He went to the [DN: Anuna] gods and prayed to them: [DN: Anuna] gods, admired by the land of [SN: Laga], protectors of all the countries, whose command, a massive breach in a dam, carries away any who try to stop it The worthy young man on whom you have looked will enjoy a long life. I, the shepherd, built the house, and now I will let my master enter his house. O [DN: Anuna] gods, may you pray on my behalf!

The true shepherd [RN: Gudea] is wise, and able too to realise things His friendly guardian went before him and his friendly protecting genius followed him For his master, Lord [DN: Ninirsu], [RN: Gudea] gave numerous gifts to the house of yore, the old house, his dwelling place He went into the [TN: E-ninnu] to the lord, and prayed to him:

His call was heard, his hero Lord [DN: Ninirsu], lord who has turned back the fierce waters, lord whose commands take precedence, male child of [DN: Enlil], warrior, I have carried out faithfully what you have ordered me to do. [DN: Ninirsu], I have built up your house for you; now I shall let you enter it in joy! My goddess [DN: Bau], I have set up your [TN: E-mi] quarters for you: take up pleasant residence in them. [DN: Ninirsu] accepted from [RN: Gudea] his prayer and supplication.

The year ended and the month was completed. A new year started, a month began and three days elapsed in that month As [DN: Ninirsu] arrived from [SN: Eridug], beautiful moonlight shone illuminating the Land, and the [TN: E-ninnu] competed with the new-born [DN: Suen].

[RN: Gudea] made a paste with cornelian and lapis lazuli and applied it to the corners He sprinkled the floor with precious oil He made the, who worked there, leave the house Syrup, ghee, wine, sour milk, fruit, fig-cakes topped with cheese, dates, and small grapes, things untouched by fire, were the foods for the gods which he prepared with syrup and ghee.

On the day when the true god was to arrive, [RN: Gudea] was busy with the evening meal from early morning. [DN: Asari] cared for the maintenance of the house. [DN: Ninmada] took care of its cleaning King [DN: Enki] gave oracular pronouncements concerning it. [DN: Nindub], the chief purification priest of [SN: Eridug], filled it with the smoke of incense The lady of precious rites, [DN: Nane], versed in singing holy songs, sang songs for the house.

They sheared the black ewes and milked the udder of the cow of heaven They cleaned the [TN: E-ninnu], they polished it with brooms of tamarisk and The ruler made the whole city kneel down, made the whole land prostrate itself He levelled what was high, rejected chance utterances ; the sorcerers' spittle was removed from the roads In the city only the mother of a sick person administered a potion The wild animals, creatures of the steppe, all had crouched together The lions and the dragons of the steppe were lying asleep.
The day was for supplication, the night was for prayer The moonlight early morning Its master.

Warrior [DN: Ninirsu] entered the house, the owner of the house had arrived He was an eagle raising its eyes toward a wild bull The warrior's entering his house was a storm roaring into battle. [DN: Ninirsu] entered his house and it became the shrine of the when there is a festival The owner came out of his house and he was [DN: Utu] rising over the land of [SN: Laga]. [DN: Bau] going to her [TN: E-mi] quarters was a true woman's taking her house in hand Her entering her bedroom was the [WN: Tigris] at high water When she sat down beside her, she was the lady, the daughter of holy [DN: An], a green garden bearing fruit.

The daylight came out, the fate had been decided. [DN: Bau] entered her [TN: E-mi] quarters, and there was abundance for the land of [SN: Laga] The day dawned. [DN: Utu] of [SN: Laga] lifted his head over the Land.

The house received fattened oxen and sheep Bowls were set up in the open air and were filled with wine The [DN: Anuna] gods of the land of [SN: Laga] gathered around Lord [DN: Ninirsu] In the house the purification had been completed, the oracular pronouncements had been taken care of.

Wine was poured from big jars while was heaped up in the [TN: E-ninnu]. [DN: Nindub] caused the sanctuary to be filled with clatter and noise and with fresh bread and hind's milk available day and night; he woke from sleep the noble one, the beloved son of [DN: Enlil], the warrior [DN: Ninirsu]. [DN: Ninirsu] raised his head with all the great powers, and rituals, for the sanctuary [TN: E-ninnu].

With his divine duties, namely to guide the hand of the righteous one; to force the evil-doer's neck into a neck stock; to keep the house safe; to keep the house pleasant; to instruct his city and the sanctuaries of [SN: irsu] ; to set up an auspicous throne; to hold the sceptre of never-ending days; to raise high the head of the shepherd called by [DN: Ninirsu], as if he wore a blue crown; and to appoint to their offices in the courtyard of [TN: E-ninnu] the skin-clad ones, the linen-clad ones and those whose head is covered, [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: Ig-alim], the Great Door ( ), the Pole ( ) of ir-nun, the chief bailiff of [SN: irsu], his beloved son, to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to keep the house clean; to let hands always be washed; to serve water to the lord with holy hands; to pour beer into bowls; to pour wine into jars; to make emmer beer in the brewery, the house of pure strength, fizz like the water of the Papsir canal; to make certain that faultless cattle and goats, grain-fed sheep, fresh bread and hind's milk are available day and night; to wake from sleep the noble one, [DN: Enlil] beloved son, the warrior [DN: Ninirsu], by offering food and drink, [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: ul-aga], the lord of the pure hand-washings ( ), the first-born son of [TN: E-ninnu], to [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to carry the seven-headed mace; to open the door of the house, the Gate of Battle; to hit exactly with the dagger blades, with the mace, with the "floodstorm" weapon and with the club, its battle tools; to inundate [DN: Enlil] enemy land, [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: Lugal-kur-dub], the warrior ar-ur, who in battle subdues all the foreign lands, the mighty general of the [TN: E-ninnu], a falcon against the rebel lands, his general, to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

After the heavenly mace had roared against the foreign lands like a fierce storm the ar-ur, the flood storm in battle, the cudgel for the rebel lands after the lord had frowned at the rebellious land, the foreign country, hurled at it his furious words, driven it insane,
With his divine duties, [RN: Gudea] introduced the lord's second general, [PN: Kur-una-buruam], to the son of [DN: Enlil].

With his divine duties, namely to send entreaties on behalf of the land of [SN: Laga] ; to perform supplications and prayers for it, propitious ones; to greet pleasantly the warrior departing for [SN: Eridug] ; and until [DN: Ninirsu] comes from [SN: Eridug], to keep the throne of the built-up city firm; to pray, with hand placed before the nose, together with [RN: Gudea], for the life of the true shepherd, [RN: Gudea] introduced his adviser, [DN: Lugal-si-sa], to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to request; to command; to co-operate with the one speaking straightforwardly; to the one speaking evil; to inform [DN: Ninirsu], the warrior sitting on a holy dais in the [TN: E-ninnu], [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: akkan], the wild ram, the minister of the [TN: E-duga], his, to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to clean with water; to clean with soap; to with oil from white bowls and with soap; to urge him to sweet sleep on his bed strewn with fresh herbs; to let him enter the [TN: E-duga], his bed chamber, from outside and to make him not wish to leave it, [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: Kinda-zid], the man in charge of the [TN: E-duga], to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to yoke up the holy chariot decorated with stars; to harness the donkey stallion, Piri-kae-pada, before it; to a slender donkey from [SN: Eridug] with the stallion; to have them joyfully transport their owner [DN: Ninirsu], [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: En-eg-nun], who roars like a lion, who rises like a flood storm, [DN: Ninirsu] hurrying bailiff, his donkey herdsman, to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely, to make the butter abundant; to make the cream abundant; to see that the butter and the milk of the holy goats, the milking goats, and the hind, the mother of [DN: Ninirsu], do not cease to flow in the [TN: E-ninnu] sanctuary, [RN: Gudea] introduced [PN: En-lulim], the herdsman of the hinds, to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to tune properly the sweet-toned instrument; to fill the courtyard of [TN: E-ninnu] with joy; to make the and, instruments of the [TN: E-duga], offer their best in the [TN: E-ninnu] to [DN: Ninirsu], the warrior with an ear for music, [RN: Gudea] introduced his beloved musician, Uumgal-kalama, to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

With his divine duties, namely to soothe the heart, to soothe the spirits; to dry weeping eyes; to banish mourning from the mourning heart; to the heart of the lord that rises like the sea, that washes away like the [WN: Euphrates], that hits like a flood storm, that has overflowed with joy after inundating a land which is [DN: Enlil] enemy, [RN: Gudea] introduced his drum, [PN: Lugal-igi-u], to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

[DN: Zazaru], [DN: Ikur-pa-e], [DN: Ur-agrunta-ea], [DN: e-ir-nuna], [DN: e-aga], [DN: Zuru] and [DN: Zaru], who are [DN: Bau] septuplets, the offspring of Lord [DN: Ninirsu], his beloved maidens, who create plenty for the myriads, stepped forward to Lord [DN: Ninirsu] with friendly entreaties on behalf of [RN: Gudea].

With his divine duties, namely to administer the open country, the pleasant place; to give directions concerning the [GN: Gu-edina], the pleasant open country; to make its birds propagate ; to have them lay their eggs in nests ; to have them rear their young; to see that the multiplication of the beasts of [DN: Ninirsu] beloved countryside does not diminish, [RN: Gudea] introduced [DN: Dim-gal-abzu], the herald of [GN: Gu-edina], to Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

The temple towered upwards in full grandeur, unparallelled in fearsomeness and radiance Like a boat it and Its owner, the warrior [DN: Ninirsu], came out as the daylight on the dais of ir-nun Its resting on supports was like the blue sky in all its splendour Its standards and their caps were [DN: Ninirsu] himself emanating fearsomeness; their leather straps stretched out in front of them were green snake-eater birds bathing Its owner, the warrior [DN: Ninirsu], stood like [DN: Utu] in his most fascinating blue chariot Its throne, standing in the hall, was [DN: An] holy seat which is sat upon joyfully Its bed, standing in the bedroom, was a young cow kneeling down in its sleeping place On its holy quilt, strewn with fresh herbs, Mother [DN: Bau] was resting comfortably with Lord [DN: Ninirsu].

[DN: An], first among the gods, seal-bearer of [DN: Enlil], life-source of [TN: E-kur], O warrior, because you have toppled the mountains your father need send out no other god beside you. [DN: Ninurta], because you have toppled the mountains [DN: Enlil] need send out no other god beside you.

While these words were yet in [DN: Nuska] mouth, [DN: Ninurta] put the whip and goad away in the rope-box He leaned his mace, the strength in battle, against the box and entered into the temple of [DN: Enlil].

He directed his captive wild bulls into the temple He directed his captive cows, like the wild bulls, into the temple He laid out the booty of his plundered cities The [DN: Anuna] were amazed. [DN: Enlil], the Great Mountain, made obeisance to him, and [DN: Aimbabbar] prayed to him.

The great mother [DN: Ninlil], from within her [TN: Ki-ur], spoke admiringly to Lord [DN: Ninurta]: [DN: Enlil], you have struck blows in the mountains Warrior, Lord [DN: Ninurta], you have You have the rebellious land.
Lord [DN: Ninurta] answered her: [DN: Ninlil], I alone cannot with you, for me alone Battle arrayed like heaven no one can rival me Like the deluge Smashing the mountains like reed huts.
[DN: Anuna] hide like mice.
axe. I bear my.

net of the rebellious land, my net. I bear that from which the mountains cannot escape, my net. I bear the seven-mouthed serpent, the slayer, my spike. I bear that which strips away the mountains, the sword, my heavenly dagger.

[DN: Enlil] bathe my heroic arms Let him pour holy water on the fierce arms which bore my weapons Let him set up a holy dais in the throne room for me Let him set my heavenly chariot upon a pedestal Let him tether my captured warriors there like butting bulls Let him have my captured kings make obeisance to me there, as to the light of heaven.

[DN: Ninurta] let them prostrate themselves at my name. I am the exceedingly mighty lion-headed one of [DN: Enlil], whom he engendered in his strength The storm of heaven, shackle of the gods, I am the one whom [DN: An] in his great might has chosen.

[DN: Inana]. I am the warrior, destined with [DN: Enki] to be suited for the fearsome divine powers Let my kingship be manifest unto the ends of heaven and earth. I am most able among the gods let me be imbued with great awesomeness.

[SN: Nibru], raise its head as high as heaven Let my city be pre-eminent among the cities of my brothers Let my temple rise the highest among the temples of my brothers Let the territory of my city be the freshwater well of [GN: Sumer] Let the [DN: Anuna], my brother gods, bow down there Let their flying birds establish nests in my city Let their refugees refresh themselves in my shade.

As [DN: Ninurta] went out from [DN: Enlil] temple, the most bright-faced of warriors, [DN: Ninkarnuna], having heard the favourable pronouncement of [DN: Ninurta], stepped before Lord [DN: Ninurta] and prayed to him:

[DN: Ninurta], may you be well-disposed towards your beloved city May you be well-disposed towards the sanctuary [SN: Nibru], your beloved city When you enter [TN: E-u-me-a], your beloved temple, alone, tell your wife, young lady [DN: Ninnibru], what is in your heart, tell her what is on your mind Make an enduring favourable pronouncement to her for the king.

The content of that prayer of the offspring of a prince, [DN: Ninkarnuna], his sprinkling [DN: Ninurta] heart with an offering of cool water, and the matter of prosperity about which he spoke were pleasing to [DN: Ninurta] heart as he went in procession to [TN: E-u-me-a] to manifest the eternal divine powers Lord [DN: Ninurta] gazed approvingly at [DN: Ninkarnuna].

When [DN: Ninurta] entered [TN: E-u-me-a], his beloved temple, alone, he told his wife, young lady [DN: Ninnibru], what was in his heart, he told her what was on his mind and he made an enduring favourable pronouncement to her for the king.
The warrior, whose heroism is manifest, [DN: Ninurta], the son of [DN: Enlil], has firmly grounded his greatness in [DN: Enlil] sanctuary.

Lord who has destroyed the mountains, who has no rival, who butts angrily in that magnificent battle, great warrior who goes forth in his might, strong one, deluge of [DN: Enlil], [DN: Ninurta], magnificent child of [TN: E-kur], pride of the father who engendered him, it is sweet to praise you.
of [DN: Ninurta].
Speak to my lord: this is what the general, your servant, says: [DN: Nanna] -ki-a
[SN: E-danna] has turned against my lord. [PN: Atta-mannum] has made six hundred troops of [RN: Gungunum] enter into [SN: E-danna].

I would not allow these troops to enter old [SN: Iri-sa-ana] They camped instead in [SN: Iri-gibil] These troops The troops of [RN: Gungunum] have come from the banks of the [WN: Id-] watercourse, in order to build, to make [RN: Amar-Suena] [SN: Dunnum] ready and to.

If my lord does not crews of highlanders, bows, arrows, small boats, fishermen, their tied-up leather sacks, weapons, and implements, the armaments of battle, then the troops will construct brick structures by the bank of the [WN: Id-] watercourse, and dig a canal. [RN: Amar-Suena]
They should not be neglectful, my lord! It is urgent!

I am a king treated with respect, good offspring from the womb. I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], the son of [DN: Enlil] From the moment I lifted my head like a cedar sapling, I have been a man who possesses strength in athletic pursuits As a young man I grew very muscular. I am a lion in all respects to the extremes, having no equal.

I am a gaping dragon, a source of great awe for the soldiers. I am like the Anzud bird, peering about in the heart of the mountains. I am a wild bull whom nobody dare oppose in its anger. I am a bison, sparkling with beautiful eyes, having a lapis-lazuli beard; I am With my kind eyes and friendly mouth, I lift people's spirits. I have a most impressive figure, lavishly endowed with beauty. I have lips appropriate for all words As I lift my arms, I have beautiful fingers. I am a very handsome young man, fine to admire.

I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], king of the Land. I am the good shepherd of the black-headed. I am the foremost in the foreign countries, and exalted in the Land. I am a human god, the lord of the numerous people. I am the strong heir of kingship Holding my head high, I am established in my position.

I am [DN: An] purification priest with purified hands. [DN: An] placed the great and good crown firmly on my head. [DN: Enlil] gave the sceptre to me, his beloved son, in the [TN: Ki-ur]. I am what makes [DN: Ninlil] happy: she determined a good fate in the [TN: a-i-ua]. I have been made excellently beautiful by [DN: Nintur], the joyful woman, in brick-built [SN: Ke]. I am one looked on favourably by [DN: Nanna]: he spoke to me affirmatively in [SN: Urim].

[DN: Uta-ulu] imbued me, the man of his heart, with great awesomeness in [TN: E-u-me-a]. I am he on whom [DN: Enki] has bestowed wisdom: he gave me kingship in [SN: Eridug] As the beloved husband of [DN: Inana], I lift my head high in the place [SN: Unug]. I am a proficient scribe of [DN: Nisaba]. I am a young man whose word [SN: Utu] confirms. I am the perfection of kingship. I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], [DN: Enlil] son.

I am he who makes an abundant crop grow, the life of the Land. I am a farmer, piling up his grain piles. I am a shepherd making butter and milk abundant in the cow-pen. I am he who makes the fish and birds grow bigger in the marshes. I am a river of plenty, bringing flowing water. I am he who increases the splendour of the great mountains. I have been given enormous strength by [DN: Enlil]. I am [DN: Lipit-Etar], his young man who respects him.

I am the provider of the gods. I am he who cares unceasingly for the [TN: E-kur]. I am the king clutching a kid to the breast as a gift. I pray in all humility. I am a king standing in prayer. I am he who speaks friendly words to appease [DN: Enlil]. I am he whose prayers make [DN: Ninlil] happy. I am he who serves [DN: Nuska] indefatigably. I am he who is ever praying at the [TN: Ki-ur] Bestowing many things, I am perfect for the foundation city. I am one who always hurries, but whose knees never tire.

Bringing first fruits, I do not pass by the [TN: E-babbar]. I am he who records abundance for [SN: Nibru]. I serve [SN: Ke] as its purification priest. I am first-rate butter and first-rate milk for [SN: Urim]. I am indefatigable with respect to [SN: Eridug]. I am he who increases the food offerings for the place [SN: Unug]. I am he to whom life was given in the [TN: E-kur]. I am he who desires liveliness for his city. I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], the shepherd of all foreign lands.

I, the king, am like pounding waves in battle Girded in manliness, I never loosen my harness. I am he who sharpens his dagger In battle I flash like lightning. A firm foundation, I repulse the troops. I am a stone, a stone. I am a siege shield, a screen for the army. A clear-eyed warrior, I make the troops firm. I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], [DN: Enlil] son Like a waterskin with cool water, I am life for the young men Keeping my eyes on the road, I am the protection the aid of the soldiers.

I am a king who, as he sits, is fitted for the throne. I am possessed of a weighty persona for speaking. I am one with a far-reaching mind and intellect, examining requests. I do not hurry over anything, but research its background. I have a far-reaching heart and broad wisdom. I am a stone that brings out of the Land. I am one that has truth in his mouth. I am one who never destroys a just person. I am a judge who, in making a decision, weighs his words fairly. I am one who is well-acquainted with giving orders to the foreign lands. I have established justice in [GN: Sumer] and [GN: Akkad], and made the Land feel content.

What of my truthful things can be thrown away? I, prince [RN: Lipit-Etar], keep the people on a straight path As regards my integrity: in what respect have I ever been idle? I am a strong person who has brought distinction to everything. I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], [DN: Enlil] son.

In my royal palace, my holy and good residence, my spouse holy [DN: Inana] made firm the foundation of my throne She will embrace me forever and eternally. I will spend all day for the Mistress in the good lapis-lazuli bedchamber that fills the heart with joy! I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], the powerful heir; I am the king that makes justice prominent May my name be called on in all the foreign lands! I am [RN: Lipit-Etar], [DN: Enlil] son It is sweet to praise me.
told her, [DN: Enlil] [DN: Ninisina], the great daughter of [DN: An], the great daughter-in-law,: [RN: Lipit-] should be your provider so let it be! [DN: Etar]

[DN: Ninisina] paid attention to [DN: Enlil] utterance She answered with humility: [DN: Enlil], god whose name is manifest, [DN: Enlil] ; lord, your divine powers are the most, your instructions are the most precious For the trustworthy shepherd, Lord [RN: Lipit-] [DN: Etar] He has settled the people, he has made the Land feel content You looked upon him with your life-giving gaze: now decree him a true fate!

[RN: Lipit-] a long life of many days! [DN: Etar]

The Great Mountain [DN: Enlil] paid attention to the words spoken by [DN: Ninisina] He blessed the king and decreed his fate: [RN: Lipit-], you whom I have called by name, shall be elevated among the people May the living look to you as to their own fathers and mothers! May the strong one who cares for [DN: Etar] [TN: E-kur], the of the august shrine, [DN: Uta-ulu], be your help on the battlefield! May he collect your enemies like swallows for you; may he spread them out like sheaves for you!

[DN: Nunamnir], the lord whose order cannot be altered, has made the name of prince [RN: Lipit-] exalted among the numerous people. [DN: Etar]
Its.
[DN: Enlil], am elevated in heaven, and am the lord of all the divine powers on earth The good fate I have decreed to Lipit- [DN: Etar] is something which can never be changed!
A of [DN: Ninisina].

O [TN: E-unir] (House which is a ziqqurat), grown together with heaven and earth, foundation of heaven and earth, great banqueting hall of [SN: Eridug]! [TN: Abzu], shrine erected for its prince, [TN: E-du-kug] (House which is the holy mound) where pure food is eaten, watered by the prince's pure canal, mountain, pure place cleansed with the potash plant, [TN: Abzu], your drums belong to the divine powers.

Your great wall is in good repair Light does not enter your meeting-place where the god dwells, the great, the beautiful place Your tightly constructed house is sacred and has no equal Your prince, the great prince, has fixed firmly a holy crown for you in your precinct O [SN: Eridug] with a crown placed on your head, bringing forth thriving thornbushes, pure thornbushes for the priests, O shrine [TN: Abzu], your place, your great place!

At your place of calling upon [DN: Utu], at your oven bringing bread to eat, on your ziqqurat, a magnificent shrine stretching toward heaven, at your great oven rivalling the great banqueting hall, your prince, the prince of heaven and earth can never be changed, the, the creator, the, the wise one, the, Lord [DN: Nudimmud], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-engura] (House of the subterranean waters), and taken his seat upon your dais.
23 lines: the house of [DN: Enki] in [SN: Eridug].

O, shrine where destiny is determined, foundation, raised with a ziqqurat, settlement of [DN: Enlil], your, your right and your left are [GN: Sumer] and [GN: Akkad] House of [DN: Enlil], your interior is cool, your exterior determines destiny Your door-jambs and architrave are a mountain summit, your projecting pilasters a dignified mountain Your peak is a peak of your princely platform Your base serves heaven and earth.

Your prince, the great prince [DN: Enlil], the good lord, the lord of the limits of heaven, the lord who determines destiny, the Great Mountain [DN: Enlil], has erected a house in your precinct, O shrine [SN: Nibru], and taken his seat upon your dais.
13 lines: the house of [DN: Enlil] in [SN: Nibru].

O [TN: Tummal], exceedingly worthy of the princely divine powers, inspiring awe and dread! Foundation, your pure lustration extends over the Primeval city, reedbed green with old reeds and new shoots, your interior is a mountain of abundance built in plenitude At your feast held in the month of the New Year, you are wondrously adorned as the great lady of [TN: Ki-ur] rivals [DN: Enlil] Your princess, Mother [DN: Ninlil], the beloved wife of [DN: Nunamnir], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-Tummal] (Tummal House), and taken a place upon your dais.
8 lines: the house of [DN: Ninlil] in [SN: Nibru].

O [TN: E-melem-u] (House of terrifying radiance) exuding great awesomeness, [TN: E-ma] (Magnificent shrine), to which princely divine powers were sent from heaven, storehouse of [DN: Enlil] founded for the primeval divine powers, worthy of nobility, lifting your head in princeship, counsellor of [TN: E-kur], parapeted buttress, your house the platform with heaven The decisions at its place of reaching the great judgment the river of the ordeal let the just live and consign to darkness the hearts that are evil In your great place fit for pure lustration and the rites of priests, you dine with Lord [DN: Nunamnir].

Your prince, the prince who is the counsellor of [DN: Enlil] and worthy of [TN: E-ma], the demon of [TN: E-kur], the leader [DN: Nuska], has erected a house in your precinct, O house of [DN: Enlil], and taken his seat upon your dais.
12 lines: the house of [DN: Nuska] in [SN: Nibru].

O [TN: E-me-ur-ana] (House which gathers the divine powers of heaven) standing in a great place, the just divine powers which the warrior, strength of battle, heroic mace, carrier of the quiver, mighty bustling brick building, your foundation is eternal Founded by the primeval lord, with decisions which belong to the princely divine powers, holy soil filling the mountain, lifting your head among the princes, magnificent house, the wonder coming from you is like the sun whose glow spreads. E-u-me-a (House which the divine powers), [DN: Enlil] has instilled your name with terrifying awesomeness.

Your prince, the great, the warrior whose strength is boundless, the great ruler for [DN: Enlil], the noble who rivals heaven and earth, the provisioning seal-keeper of Father [DN: Enlil] who makes the great divine powers perfect, the, the leader for Father [DN: Enlil], the foremost, the lion engendered by the Great Mountain, who destroys the hostile lands for [DN: Enlil], Lord [DN: Ninurta], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-u-me-a], and taken his seat upon your dais.
15 lines: the house of [DN: Ninurta] in [SN: Nibru].

O [TN: E-a-duda] (House, chamber of the mound), crown of the high plain, holy place, pure place, house, your foundation is a great princely mooring pole. [TN: Du-sa-dili] (Singular mound), your lady, the singular woman who keeps the chamber and the dais full, gladdens your platform in princely style Your princess who avoids anger and is exceedingly wise, the princely daughter who prospers together with the Great Mountain, [DN: u-zi-ana], the junior wife of Father [DN: Enlil], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: Du-sa-dili], and taken her seat upon your dais.
9 lines: the house of [DN: u-zi-ana] in [TN: a-gi-ma].

O mighty [SN: Ke], form of heaven and earth, arousing terror like a great horned viper, house of [DN: Ninursaa], built in a terrifying place! Respected [SN: Ke], your interior is a deep interior while your exterior is tall Great lion on the high plain and roving about on the plain, great hill established by incantations, twilit interior in which moonlight does not shine, [DN: Nintur] has made you beautiful O house [SN: Ke], your brickwork and your moulding of it! Your terrace! Your exterior, a lustrous crown, and your building of it!

Your princess, the silencing princess, the true and great lady of heaven when she talks heaven trembles, when she opens her mouth a storm thunders [DN: Aruru], the sister of [DN: Enlil], has erected a house in your precinct, O house [SN: Ke], and taken her seat upon your dais.
13 lines: the house of [DN: Ninursaa] in [SN: Ke].

O [SN: Urim], bull standing in the wet reeds, [TN: E-ki-nu-al] (House sending light to the earth ), calf of a great cow, light of holy heaven, trap laid in a nest, [SN: Urim], container feeding all lands, you are a shrine in a pure place, earth of [DN: An] O house of [DN: Suen], at your front a prince, at your back a ruler, your dining hall with songs, your great, holy banqueting hall with and drums! The light coming from you and your true lordship is a precious destiny.

, princely shrine of the holy divine powers, shining like the sun, [TN: E-ki-nu-al], beaming moonlight which comes forth in the Land, broad light of midday which fills all lands, house, your platform is a great snake, a marsh of snakes Your foundation is the, fifty in number, and the, seven in number, a shrine which looks into the heart of the gods Your prince, the prince who makes decisions, the crown of the wide heaven, the sovereign of heaven, [DN: Aimbabbar], has erected a house in your precinct, O shrine [SN: Urim], and taken his seat upon your dais.
17 lines: the house of [DN: Nanna] in [SN: Urim].

O [TN: E-mu-ma] (House with a magnificent name), rising mountain of heaven, your holy sides and your great foundation are a precious destiny Interior full with princely divine powers, a beaming light which shines, shrine with your back to the blue sky and your prominent front to all people, in the Land it represents a binding agreement and a single track Magnificent river with open mouth gathering together your divine powers, your base is great in awesomeness, a righteous hill grown in a broad place Your lofty dwelling-place of magnificence with all the divine powers of princeship, shouting ; house of celebration, your platform gladdens the settlements.

House, your prince [RN: ulgi] has made it great and most princely The perfect and magnificent, the mighty and great wind, adorned with the divine powers, determining destiny, [RN: ulgi] of [DN: An], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-ursa] (House which is a hill), and taken his seat upon your dais.
15 lines: addition: [TN: E-ursa] of [RN: ulgi] in [SN: Urim].

O city, from the like barley, cloudy plain, taking the divine powers from its midst, [SN: Kuara], your foundation and just banqueting hall, the lord who does not hold back his goods stands ready for admiration The Seven Sages have enlarged it for you from the south to the uplands.

Your prince, the most precious prince [DN: Asarlui], the most precious one, is a warrior, born a noble prince, a leopard who seizes prey He is like an onrushing storm battering the rebel land As long as it remains disobedient, he pours spittle upon it. [DN: Asar-alim-nuna], the son of the, has erected a house in your precinct, O house [SN: Kuara], and taken his seat upon your dais.
11 lines: the house of [DN: Asarlui] in [SN: Kuara].

O [TN: E-gud-du-ar] (House with numerous perfect oxen) of holy stone in which its sovereign sits, raising a magnificent door decoration for the princely son, whose best fine oil is holy and well-prepared, [TN: a-bura] (Chamber of bowls), holy cattle-pen pasturing cows with plants, your prince is a great wild bull, an elephant rejoicing in its own strength, a wild cow growing horns and and delighting in its shining horns The incantation priest of opposed languages who put clouds in the sky, the storm which roars in the sky, as the sunlight giving to the earth, [DN: Ningublaga], the son of [DN: Nanna], has erected a house in your precinct, O [SN: Ki-abrig], and taken his seat upon your dais.
10 lines: the house of [DN: Ningublaga] in [SN: Ki-abrig].

O shrine, great sanctuary founded at a cattle-pen, small shining city of [DN: Suen], [TN: Kar-zida] (Pure quay), your interior is a mighty place, your foundation is holy and clean Shrine, your is founded in purity Your door is of strong copper set up at a great place Lowing cattle-pen, you raise your horns like a bull Your prince, the lord of heaven standing in joy, at midday and, [DN: Aimbabbar], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: Kar-zida], and taken his seat upon your dais.
10 lines: the house of [DN: Nanna] in [SN: Gae].

O house which comes forth from heaven, resplendent in [SN: Kulaba], shrine [TN: E-babbar] (Shining house), shining bull, lift your neck to [DN: Utu] who in the sky! Your shining horns are aggressive, holy and lustrous Bearing a beard of shining lapis lazuli, your prince, the mighty sunlight, the lord who the true word, who lightens the horizon, who lightens the sky's vault, [DN: Utu], the sovereign of [TN: E-babbar], has erected a house in your precinct, O house [SN: Larsam], and taken his seat upon your dais.
9 lines: the house of [DN: Utu] in [SN: Larsam].

O [SN: Enegir], great libation pipe, libation pipe to the underworld of [DN: Erekigala], of [GN: Sumer] where mankind is gathered, [TN: E-gida] (Long house), in the land your shadow has stretched over the princes of the land Your prince, the seed of the great lord, the sacred one of the great underworld, given birth by [DN: Erekigala], playing loudly on the instrument, sweet as the voice of a calf, [DN: Ninazu] of the words of prayer, has erected a house in your precinct, O house [SN: Enegir], and taken his seat upon your dais.
7 lines: the house of [DN: Ninazu] in [SN: Enegir].

O primeval place, deep mountain founded in an artful fashion, shrine, terrifying place lying in a pasture, a dread whose lofty ways none can fathom, [SN: ibanda], neck-stock, meshed net, shackles of the great underworld from which none can escape, your exterior is raised up, prominent like a snare, your interior is where the sun rises, endowed with wide-spreading plenty Your prince is the prince who stretches out his pure hand, the holy one of heaven, with luxuriant and abundant hair hanging at his back, Lord [DN: Ninizida]. [DN: Ninizida] has erected a house in your precinct, O [SN: ibanda], and taken his seat upon your dais.
10 lines: the house of [DN: Ninizida] in [SN: ibanda].

O house with the great divine powers of [SN: Kulaba], its platform has made the great shrine flourish Green fresh fruit, marvellous, filled with ripeness, descending from the centre of heaven, shrine built for the bull, [TN: E-ana] (House of heaven), house with seven corners, with seven fires lifted at night-time, surveying seven pleasures, your princess is on the pure horizon.

Your lady [DN: Inana] who, who adorns the woman and covers the man's head with a cloth, the one with a lustrous crown, the dragon of Niin-ar, the queen of heaven and earth, [DN: Inana], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-ana], and taken her seat upon your dais.
11 lines: the house of [DN: Inana] in [SN: Unug].

O house where lustrous herbs are strewn upon the flowery bed, the bed-chamber of holy [DN: Inana], where the lady of the plain refreshes herself! Brick-built [TN: E-mu] (House which is the precinct) is flowery and holy, its clay established for him who tends the ewes on the high plain Your house of [GN: Arali] (House which is the nether world) gives shade to the shepherd Your prince, a raging lion on the plain, the jewel of the Mistress whose breast is holy and marvellous, the lord who is holy [DN: Inana] husband, [DN: Dumuzid], the sovereign of [TN: E-mu], has erected a house in your precinct, O [SN: Bad-tibira], and taken his seat upon your dais.
10 lines: the house of [DN: Dumuzid] in [SN: Bad-tibira].

O [TN: E-igizu-uru] (House, your face is mighty), with plenty coming from within, your well-stocked chamber is a mountain of abundance House, your fragrance is a mound of vines Your true minister is a leader in heaven House, your princess is prominent among the gods, the true minister of [TN: E-ana] who holds a holy sceptre in her hand. [DN: Ninubur], the true minister of [TN: E-ana], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-akkil] (House of lamentation), and taken her seat upon your dais.
8 lines: the house of [DN: Ninubur] in [SN: Akkil].
O city, founded upon a dais in the, established for the rites of priests, house where incantations of heaven and earth are recited,

lustration water in the holy heaven and on the pure earth. [DN: Ningirim], the lady of the shining lustration water, has erected a house in your precinct, O house [SN: Murum], and taken her seat upon your dais.
9 lines: the house of [DN: Ningirim] in [SN: Murum].

O [TN: E-ninnu] (House of 50), right hand of [SN: Laga], foremost in [GN: Sumer], the Anzud bird which gazes upon the mountain, the weapon of [DN: Ninirsu], in all lands, the strength of battle, a terrifying storm which envelops men, giving the strength of battle to the [DN: Anuna], the great gods, brick building on whose holy mound destiny is determined, beautiful as the hills, your canal, your blowing in opposition at your gate facing towards [SN: Iri-kug], wine is poured into holy [DN: An] beautiful bowls set out in the open air.

Whatever enters you is unequalled, whatever leaves endures. terrifying facade, house of radiance, a place of reaching judgment which Lord [DN: Ninirsu] has filled with great awesomeness and dread! All the [DN: Anuna] gods attend your great drinking-bouts.

Your prince, a raging storm which destroys cities in hostile lands, your sovereign, a terrifying wild ox which will manifest its strength, a terrifying lion which smashes heads, the warrior who devises strategies in lordship and attains victory in kingship, the mighty one, the great warrior in battle, the lord without rival, the son of [DN: Enlil], Lord [DN: Ninirsu], has erected a house in your precinct, O [TN: E-ninnu], and taken his seat upon your dais.

O [SN: Iri-kug] (Holy city), shrine of holy [DN: An], which caused the human seed to come forth, called by a good name, within you is the river of ordeal which vindicates the just man. [DN: Enlil] commands are by far the loftiest, his words commands are holy, his utterances are immutable! The mighty lord, the greatest in heaven and earth, the knowledgeable judge, the wise one of wide-ranging wisdom, has taken his seat in the [TN: Dur-an-ki], and made the [TN: Ki-ur], the great place, resplendent with majesty He has taken up residence in [SN: Nibru], the lofty bond between heaven and earth The front of the city is laden with terrible fearsomeness and radiance, its back is such that even the mightiest god dare not attack, and its interior is the blade of a sharp dagger, a blade of catastrophe For the rebel lands it is a snare, a trap set with a net.

It cuts short the life of those who speak too mightily It permits no evil word to be spoken in judgment. deception, inimical speech, hostility, impropriety, ill-treatment, wickedness, wrongdoing, looking askance, violence, slandering, arrogance, licentious speech, egotism and boasting are abominations not tolerated within the city.

The borders of [SN: Nibru] form a great net, within which the eagle spreads wide its talons The evil or wicked man does not escape its grasp In this city endowed with steadfastness, for which righteousness and justice have been made a lasting possession, and which is clothed in pure clothing on the quay, the younger brother honours the older brother and treats him with human dignity; people pay attention to a father's word and reap the benefits; the child behaves humbly and modestly towards his mother and attains a ripe old age.

In the city, the holy settlement of [DN: Enlil], in [SN: Nibru], the beloved shrine of father Great Mountain, he has made the dais of abundance, the [TN: E-kur], the shining temple, rise from the soil; he has made it grow on pure land as high as a towering mountain Its prince, the Great Mountain, Father [DN: Enlil], has taken his seat on the dais of the [TN: E-kur], the lofty shrine No god can cause harm to the temple's divine powers Its holy hand-washing rites are everlasting like the earth Its divine powers are the divine powers of the: no one can look upon them.

Its interior is a wide sea which knows no horizon In its glistening as a banner, the bonds and ancient divine powers are made perfect Its words are prayers, its incantations are supplications Its word is a favourable omen, its rites are most precious At the festivals, there is plenty of fat and cream; they are full of abundance Its divine plans bring joy and rejoicing, its verdicts are great Daily there is a great festival, and at the end of the day there is an abundant harvest The temple of [DN: Enlil] is a mountain of abundance; to reach out, to look with greedy eyes, to seize are abominations in it.

The priests of this temple whose lord has grown together with it are expert in blessing; its priests of the are suited for your lustration rites; its priests are perfect in the holy prayers Its great farmer is the good shepherd of the Land, who was born vigorous on a propitious day The farmer, suited for the broad fields, comes with rich offerings; he does not into the shining [TN: E-kur].

[DN: Enlil], when you marked out the holy settlements, you also built [SN: Nibru], your own city You the [TN: Ki-ur], the mountain, your pure place You founded it in the [TN: Dur-an-ki], in the middle of the four quarters of the earth Its soil is the life of the Land, and the life of all the foreign countries Its brickwork is red gold, its foundation is lapis lazuli You made it glisten on high raised its glistening top in [GN: Sumer] as if it were the horns of a wild bull It makes all the foreign countries tremble with fear At its great festivals, the people pass their time in abundance.

[DN: Enlil], holy [DN: Ura] is favoured with beauty for you; you are greatly suited for the, the holy throne ; you refresh yourself in the deep underworld, the holy chamber Your presence spreads awesomeness over the [TN: E-kur], the shining temple, the lofty dwelling Its fearsomeness and radiance reach up to heaven, its shadow stretches over all the foreign lands, and its crenellation reaches up to the midst of heaven All lords and sovereigns regularly supply holy offerings there, approaching [DN: Enlil] with prayers and supplications.

[DN: Enlil], if you look upon the shepherd favourably, if you elevate the one truly called in the Land, then the foreign countries are in his hands, the foreign countries are at his feet! Even the most distant foreign countries submit to him He will then cause enormous incomes and heavy tributes, as if they were cool water, to reach the treasury In the great courtyard he will supply offerings regularly Into the [TN: E-kur], the shining temple, he will bring.

[DN: Enlil], faithful shepherd of the teeming multitudes, herdsman, leader of all living creatures, has manifested his rank of great prince, adorning himself with putting on the holy crown As the Wind of the Mountain occupied the dais, he spanned the sky as the rainbow Like a floating cloud, he moved alone.

He alone is the prince of heaven, the dragon of the earth The lofty god of the [DN: Anuna] himself determines the fates No god can look upon him His great minister and commander chief barber [DN: Nuska] learns his commands and his intentions from him, consults with him and then executes his far-reaching instructions on his behalf He prays to him with holy prayers and divine powers.

Without the Great Mountain [DN: Enlil], no city would be built, no settlement would be founded; no cow-pen would be built, no sheepfold would be established; no king would be elevated, no lord would be given birth; no high priest or priestess would perform extispicy; soldiers would have no generals or captains; no carp-filled waters would dredge the rivers at their peak; the carp would not come straight up from the sea, they would not dart about The sea would not produce all its heavy treasure, no freshwater fish would lay eggs in the reedbeds, no bird of the sky would build nests in the spacious land; in the sky the thick clouds would not open their mouths; on the fields, dappled grain would not fill the arable lands, vegetation would not grow lushly on the plain; in the gardens, the spreading trees forests of the mountain would not yield fruits.

Without the Great Mountain [DN: Enlil], [DN: Nintur] would not kill, she would not strike dead; no cow would drop its calf in the cattle-pen, no ewe would bring forth a lamb in its sheepfold; the living creatures which multiply by themselves would not lie down in their sit within ; the four-legged animals would not propagate, they would not mate.

[DN: Enlil], your ingenuity takes one's breath away! By its nature it is like entangled threads which cannot be unravelled, crossed threads which the eye cannot follow Your divinity can be relied on You are your own counsellor and adviser, you are a lord on your own Who can comprehend your actions? No divine powers are as resplendent as yours No god can look you in the face.

You, [DN: Enlil], are lord, god, king You are a judge who makes decisions about heaven and earth Your lofty word is as heavy as heaven, and there is no one who can lift it The [DN: Anuna] gods at your word Your word is weighty in heaven, a foundation on the earth In the heavens, it is a great, reaching up to the sky On the earth it is a foundation which cannot be destroyed When it relates to the heavens, it brings abundance: abundance will pour from the heavens When it relates to the earth, it brings prosperity: the earth will produce prosperity Your word means flax, your word means grain Your word means the early flooding, the life of the lands It makes the living creatures, the animals which copulate and breathe joyfully in the greenery You, Enlil, the good shepherd, know their ways. the sparkling stars.

You married [DN: Ninlil], the holy consort, whose words are of the heart, her of noble countenance in a holy garment, her of beautiful shape and limbs, the trustworthy lady of your choice Covered with allure, the lady who knows what is fitting for the [TN: E-kur], whose words of advice are perfect, whose words bring comfort like fine oil for the heart, who shares sits on the holy throne, the pure throne with you, she takes counsel and discusses matters with you You decide the fates together at the place facing the sunrise. [DN: Ninlil], the lady of heaven and earth, the lady of all the lands, is honoured in the praise of the Great Mountain.

Prominent one whose words are well established, whose command and support are things which are immutable, whose utterances take precedence, whose plans are firm words, Great Mountain, Father [DN: Enlil], your praise is sublime!

There was a city, there was a city the one we live in. [SN: Nibru] was the city, the one we live in. [SN: Dur-inimbar] was the city, the one we live in. [WN: Id-sala] is its holy river, [SN: Kar-etina] is its quay. [SN: Kar-asar] is its quay where boats make fast Pu-lal is its freshwater well. [WN: Id-nunbir-tum] is its branching canal, and if one measures from there, its cultivated land is 50 each way. [DN: Enlil] was one of its young men, and [DN: Ninlil] was one its young women. [DN: Nun-bar-e-gunu] was one of its wise old women.

At that time the maiden was advised by her own mother, [DN: Ninlil] was advised by [DN: Nun-bar-e-gunu]: [DN: Ninlil], don't walk along the bank of the [WN: Id-nunbir-tum]! His eye is bright, the lord's eye is bright, he will look at you! The Great Mountain, Father [DN: Enlil] his eye is bright, he will look at you! The shepherd who decides all destinies his eye is bright, he will look at you! Straight away he will want to have intercourse, he will want to kiss! He will be happy to pour lusty semen into the womb, and then he will leave you to it!

She advised her from the heart, she gave wisdom to her The river is holy; the woman bathed in the holy river As [DN: Ninlil] walked along the bank of the [WN: Id-nunbir-tum], his eye was bright, the lord's eye was bright, he looked at her The Great Mountain, Father [DN: Enlil] his eye was bright, he looked at her The shepherd who decides all destinies his eye was bright, he looked at her The king said to her, but he could not make her let him. [DN: Enlil] said to her, but he could not make her let him.

[DN: Enlil] spoke to his minister [DN: Nuska]: [DN: Nuska], my minister! [TN: E-kur]! The minister brought his master across by boat, bringing him over with the rope of a small boat, bringing him over in a big boat The lord, floating downstream to he was actually to have intercourse with her, he was actually to kiss her! Father [DN: Ninlil], so beautiful, so radiant? [DN: Enlil], floating downstream to he was actually to have intercourse with her, he was actually to kiss her! he grasped hold of her whom he was seeking he was actually to have intercourse with her, he was actually to kiss her! so as to lie with her on a small bank He actually had intercourse with her, he actually kissed her At this one intercourse, at this one kissing he poured the seed of [DN: Suen] - [DN: Aimbabbar] into her womb.

[DN: Enlil] was walking in the [TN: Ki-ur] As [DN: Enlil] was going about in the [TN: Ki-ur], the fifty great gods and the seven gods who decide destinies had [DN: Enlil] arrested in the [TN: Ki-ur]. [DN: Enlil], the ritually impure, left the city. [DN: Nunamnir], the ritually impure, left the city. [DN: Enlil], ritually impure, leave the city! [DN: Nunamnir], ritually impure, leave the city! [DN: Enlil], in accordance with what had been decided, [DN: Nunamnir], in accordance with what had been decided, [DN: Enlil] went. [DN: Ninlil] followed. [DN: Nunamnir] went, the maiden chased him.

[DN: Enlil] spoke to the man at the city gate: [DN: Ninlil] comes, if she asks after me, don't tell her where I am! [DN: Ninlil] addressed the city gatekeeper: She spoke to him; [DN: Enlil] go by?
